loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 2 hijos  a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que trabaja fuertemente todos los días en su taller de confección con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos para el hogar y poder salir adelante. Desde que el padre de sus hijos la abandonó, Luz Marina comenzó a trabajar fuertemente en la actividad de la confección, la cual ya conocía gracias a una familiar que se dedicaba a esta actividad y en ocasiones le colaboraba en su trabajo. Gracias a la experiencia que tenía logró sacar su propio taller adelante y así lograr prestar el servicio de confección a terceros, y actualmente gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes. Debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital en su taller, debe afrontar ciertas dificultades cuando le hacen grandes pedidos; pero ahora que tiene la oportunidad busca un préstamo para comprar insumos y materias primas para la elaboración de unos pedidos que le han hecho unos clientes, y también para realizar mantenimiento a sus 3 máquinas.

De esta manera podrá superar la dificultad de capital en su negocio y así poder sacar adelante su taller. Su mayor sueño es generar empleo en su taller de confección y enseñarles la actividad a otras personas para que saquen sus familias adelante.
texts.en: Luz Marina is the single mother of two children who she has always wanted to provide with a better quality of life.  This is why she works hard every day in her dressmaking workshop, with the aim of improving her household income and making progress in life.  When her children's father abandoned her, Luz Marina started working hard in her dressmaking activities.  She was already familiar with this work thanks to a family member who worked in the same business and who she used to help out occasionally.  Thanks to the experience she already had, Luz Marina was able to start up her own workshop and provide dressmaking services to third parties.  Thanks to the good quality of her products, she currently has very good orders from her customers.  Owing to the fact that she doesn't have a lot of capital, she faces certain difficulties when people place large orders with her.  However, she now has the opportunity to take out a loan and buy the supplies and raw materials she needs to fill her orders.  She is also able to have her three sewing machines serviced.  This will enable her to overcome the problems she faces as a result of her lack of capital and she will be able to make progress in her business.  Her biggest dream is to create jobs in her dressmaking workshop and to teach the business to other people so that they can provide for their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials so that she can fill some orders that customers have placed.  She will also have her three sewing machines serviced

loans.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es:
Luis se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos para su hogar tiene un taller donde fabrica artesanías en madera y las comercializa a diferentes fincas que hay en el sector. La actividad la aprendió empíricamente viendo a unos amigos y posteriormente comenzó a trabajar en esta, y ahora gracias a la experiencia que tiene ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes que le garantizan sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Debido a que ahora tiene muy buenos pedidos su capacidad de producción no puede responder a todos los pedidos, por esto busca un préstamo para aumentar su capacidad de producción comprando un taladro, una caladora y materias primas para la elaboración de las artesanías.

De esta manera logrará aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio y así brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes, al mismo tiempo en que aumentará sus ventas considerablemente y así los ingresos para el hogar. Su mayor sueño es comercializar sus productos en otras regiones y tener un gran negocio con el que su familia tenga la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en: Luis is married and has a 16-year-old son.  In order to make income for his household, he has a workshop where he makes wooden handicrafts.  He sells his products on different large estates in his area.  He learned his trade empirically by watching some friends and then starting work himself.  Now, thanks to his experience, he has managed to attract a large number of customers.  This guarantees him income with which he is able to cover his household expenses.  Owing to the fact that he now has very good orders, Luis' production capacity is not sufficient and he is unable to fill all his orders.  For this reason, he is looking for a loan to increase his production capacity.  He will buy a drill, a jigsaw and raw materials for making his handicrafts.  This will increase his production capacity and he will be able to provide his customers with a better service.  At the same time, his sales will increase considerably, as too will his household income.  Luis' biggest dream is to sell his products in other regions and to have a large business so that his family can enjoy a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for making progress.

loans.use: to buy a drill, a jigsaw and raw materials for making handicrafts

loans.name: Eglecerio

texts.en:
Eglecerio is a 36-year-old fisherman living in Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the fishing business for 20 years now and works hard to provide for the needs of his family, including his five children, ages five, nine, 11, 12, and 15.

Eglecerio is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to buy new fishing net and repair his fishing boat. In the future, he hopes to improve his business and to reinvest in it so that he can provide for his family’s growing needs, especially the schooling of his children. Eglecerio believes that education is the only wealth that no one can take away from you and that's the reason why it is so important that his children are educated.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net and repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 46 years old and married with four children who are in school.  For the past 23 years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie has borrowed 20 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rosemarie is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men, 53, is a diligent woman, devoting her full attention to her farm and crops. She works tirelessly in the field to earn a good income and provide an education to her children. Three of Men’s children are married and the other four are still dependents who live together with her under the same roof in Baray, Kompong Tom province. Men grows various kinds of crops such as rice, potatoes, and beans, to sell each harvesting season. She has been a farmer for over 10 years and her children serve as her motivation to work hard in her business.

Men is requesting a loan through HKL to purchase potato plants, fertilizer, and pesticide. She believes that her loan will help her to increase her yields and income through patience and hard work. Men plans to build a strong business and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase potato plants, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and married with three children. For the past 28 years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan has borrowed 22 previous loans through NWTF to sustain her business.

Susan is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old and married with one child. He operates a retail shop to earn a living and has one employee. Paul has learned how to save money with the financial management training that he has received through Faulu Kenya.

Paul is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy sugar, rice, and maize to sell. In the future, he dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and maize flour

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is married with five children between the ages of one and 18. Four of his children attend school and his wife works as a maize farmer. Cyprien has been a maize farmer for 10 years. In Rwanda, the agricultural sector accounts for 37% of the country’s gross domestic product; generates 65% of its export revenue; and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending for agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

Cyprien is requesting a loan to buy more seeds, to harvest seeds, and to pay for labor costs to help him with his harvest. He plans to use the profit from his loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy and harvest seed and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 26 years old and married. For the past three years, he has operated a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. Dennis has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He also has learned how to save money with the financial management training that he has received through Faulu Kenya.

Dennis is requesting a 65,000 KES loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and employ people.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 34 years old and married without children. She lives in Lumangkapan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. For the past two years, Shiela has run a grocery store. She earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month and has been a Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative member for over a year.

Shiela is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase stock for her grocery store. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 38 years old and married with three children. For the past 10 years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling charcoal. Amy works hard to provide for her family. 

Amy is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 34 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past 15 years, she has run a charcoal business in the Philippines. Alma works very hard to provide for her family.

Alma is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a fruit vendor. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been buying and selling a variety of fruit for the past 15 years. To earn additional income, she also engages in vegetable farming. 

She is requesting PhP 24,500 through NWTF in order to buy additional fruits to offer for sale.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruit to offer for sale

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda, age 42, runs a general store to earn an income. She has operated her business for five years. To earn additional income, she also engages in fishing. She and her husband have seven children.

Emelda works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and successfully repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She is currently requesting a PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy a stock of additional merchandise to offer for sale.

Emelda aspires toward saving enough money to secure her children's college educations.

loans.use: to buy a stock of additional merchandise to offer for sale

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en: Fouzia appears in this photo raising her hand. She is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s dairy and livestock business. With the loan investment, Fouzia’s husband will buy a young buffalo to rear and sell. He will also sell its milk to earn extra income. Fouzia’s husband is very hardworking and efficient in his work. His clients are very happy with his professionalism, milk quality, and rates. Fouzia provides full support to her husband in his business and she takes care of the cattle very well. She is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her husband and will improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy and rear a young buffalo for milk and profit

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda operates a fishing and fish vending business to earn a living. She is married with children and she works hard to support her family. She has been engaged in her business for the past 20 years. 

Erlinda has requested a PhP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase necessary materials for her new fishing boat.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to ensure her children's college educations.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for her new fishing boat

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin is 51 years old and is married and blessed with seven children. She and her husband work as rice farmers and together they are raising their family in a small village in Baray district, Kompong Tom. Bin has been a farmer for more than 12 years. She has been able to educate her last-born child who is currently attending high school. Her other children have independent lives.

Bin is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay the labor costs incurred working her farm. She believes that her loan will enable her family to develop their farming business and she hopes to have a fruitful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Adjokè Amina's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Adjokè Amina, la responsable, est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants tous scolarisés. Adjokè Amina vend des chaussures et articles de mercerie depuis des années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et de participer à la scolarisation des enfants, Adjokè Amina a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Adjokè Amina se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This is a solidarity loan for a group of two persons. Adjoke Amina, the group's representative, is 44 years old. She is the mother of five children, all in school. Adjoke Amina has been selling shoes and sewing supplies for years, stocking up at a market  in Benin. In order to respond to customer demand and help pay for her children's schooling, Adjoke Amina has requested and obtained a microloan from Finadev. Adjoke Amina is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 10 pairs of shoes and one box of sewing supplies.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Baasansuren, age 30, runs a business selling clothing in one of the supermarkets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband in the ger district. A "ger" is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and the ger district is an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. 

She has been engaged in her business for three years, operating from a rental stall. She is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing a car. Her husband will use it to run a taxi business as well as to help his wife transport her clothing items to the workshop. 

They have already saved some of the money needed to purchase the car, and Mrs. Baasansuren is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 MNT to cover the remaining costs. Having this car will allow both of them to execute their business activities and earn a more profitable income together.

loans.use: to cover the remaining costs of purchasing a car for her business

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en:
Ghaith is a 21-year-old single guy who is the youngest among three siblings. He is a university student who is in the process of taking his bachelor’s degree. 

Ghaith is requesting a loan to pay for his upcoming summer semester registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for summer semester registration fees

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, age 33, runs a general store to earn an income. She has operated her business for the past year. She earns additional income from food vending and farming rice. Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She and her husband have five children.

Jocelyn has borrowed and successfully repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She is currently requesting a PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy a stock of merchandise to offer for sale.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family. She is determined to ensure that her children receive college educations.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise to offer for sale

loans.name: La Paix Virunga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est entrepreneur dynamique, Leader du groupe d’affaire « La paix Virunga », mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est actuellement sans emploi. La cliente est vendeuse des Farines de maïs(semoules)au marché central de Virunga. Environs 3 ans, elle exerce cette activité génératrice de revenus. Elle démarra son business avec le prêt reçu de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 5 sacs de farines de maïs (semoules) à marchander. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.
texts.en:
Furaha is a dynamic entrepreneure and leader of the business group "La paix Virunga" (the Virunga Peace). She is a married mother of seven children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Furaha sells maize flour (cornmeal) at the central market of Virunga. She has been engaged in this income-generating activity for about three years. She started her business with a loan from the Hekima MFI.

This new loan will allow her to buy five bags of cornmeal for resale. She plans to expand her business and support her children’s tuition. 

Furaha thanks the Hekima MFI for helping poor people who do not have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy five bags of cornmeal for resale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is married with six children. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elma is a farmer and she operates a banana production to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and every month she earn 5,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Elma joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Elma hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en:
Jameelah is 38 years old and a married woman caring for five children; she also has a married daughter.

Jameeleh helps in paying for the households bills from the income she gets from her small convenience store. Now she has applied for this loan to bring in more food products to increase her income.

loans.use: to bring in more food products

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married with two children. Elma is 50 years old and lives in Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Elma has a transportation business. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 8,000. She has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair. Elma has been a member of PMPC for six months.

In the future, Elma hopes to have good living conditions and a progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair

loans.name: Aminath

texts.fr: Aminath est mariée et mère de 03 enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des produits cosmétiques depuis des années et se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. Sa clientèle large et variée est composée essentiellement des béninoises et des togolaises. Soucieuse d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Le présent financement lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'améliorer le régime alimentaire de sa famille.
texts.en: Aminath is married and the mother of three children who attend school.  The oldest is 12 and the youngest is 2.  She has a shop where she has been selling cosmetic products for years, and she gets her supplies at one of the markets in her area.  Her customer base is large and varied, composed mainly of women from Bénin and Togo.   In hopes of increasing her turnover and to meet the demands of her customers, she has requested and received a loan through Finadev. The current loan will allow her to contribute to the education of her children and to improve her family’s diet.

loans.use: to buy 2 cases of body lotion, one case of soap, and two cases of perfume of various quality.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtuya, age 43, has been running a stall for 12 years behind a bus station in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has gained a lot of experience and dexterity in her business. She lives with her husband and her son in an area of the city that has no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. 

Mrs. Enkhtuya owns a house that was built in the early 1990s and has never undergone repairs or renovations. In the last several years, the poor insulation has caused heat loss and emissions trough the house's walls and windows. This causes her to spend too much money on smoky coal to warm her home in the winter time. 

Also, Mrs. Enkhtuya thinks using coal is very harmful to the environment, especially due to air pollution. This is why she wants to insulate her house. Now she needs some money to buy the building materials such as the foam, cement, bricks and rock wool for wall insulation. She is planning to do it within the summer months. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C, even in the cities. Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. Additionally, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of the main reasons for Mongolian hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that use less gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy some building materials to insulate her house.

loans.use: To buy some building materials to insulate her house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Josephine has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Josephine has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Joylyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Joylyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Joylyn has been sustaining her business through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Esterlita sells fruits in her local community. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to buy more fruits to resell, like guava, santol and lansones.

She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is from Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Hazel owns and operates a business selling cosmetic and fragrance products. She has been in this business for seven years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Hazel joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Girlisa

texts.en:
Girlisa is from Manla, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Girlisa is married and has four children. She plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living. 

Girlisa has owned her business for five years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2010, Girlisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlisa is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: William Dario

texts.es:
William tiene un gran negocio que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo, y el cual gracias a su dedicación le generar unos ingresos con los cuales puede ofrecer en su hogar una buena calidad de vida a su familia. El negocio comenzó siendo una distribución de snack y galletas, donde tiene varios sectores de la ciudad donde los comercializa y abastece una gran cantidad de negocios; y posteriormente dadas las oportunidades en el sector, montó en su negocio un servicio de cibercafé y videojuegos. De esta manera sus ingresos han mejorado considerablemente y su familia ha tenido así la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. La distribución del snack y las galletas la hace en un vehículo que compró con un préstamo a un alto interés, pues anteriormente no tenía la posibilidad de acceder a una entidad financiera, pero ahora busca un préstamo para pagar el vehículo donde distribuye el snack y las galletas y así pagar menos intereses.

Su mayor sueño es seguir teniendo su negocio con unas buenas ventas y seguir ofreciendo en su familia una buena calidad de vida. Además, espera seguir creciendo y tener más clientes en diferentes sectores de la ciudad para generar más empleo, ya que ahora tiene la oportunidad de generar un empleo en su negocio.
texts.en:
William has a great business that he has moved forward with much effort. Thanks to his dedication, he has generated income which enables him to offer his family a better quality of life. The business started out as distributing snacks and cookies. William has various areas where he sells and supplies a large number of businesses. Later, he was given opportunities in the area and set up a cybercafe and video games in his business. Through this initiative, his income has increased considerably and his family has also had the opportunity to have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities in order to progress. William carries out his snack and cookie distribution in a vehicle that he bought through a high interest loan since he previously had not had the option of accessing a financial institution. However, now he is seeking a loan to pay for the vehicle he uses to distribute snacks and cookies so he will have to pay less interest.

His greatest dream is to continue to have good sales in his business and to continue to offer his family a good quality of life. Also, he hopes to continue growing and to have more customers in different areas of the city to generate more jobs, since right now he has the opportunity to create a job at his business.

loans.use: to pay for a vehicle to distribute snacks and cookies, and therefore pay less interest

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 37 years old and married with five children.

Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Jonalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, age 20, is a single guy who is majoring in accounting for his bachelor's degree.

He is in his second year now and is trying to register for the summer semester. He has applied for this loan to pay for his registration fees.

Mohammad has five brothers and sisters and they all live with their parents.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for a semester at college.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 54 years old and married with four children.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Josefa has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Josefa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ligia Amparo

texts.es:
Ligia es una madre soltera cabeza de hogar de su hijo a quien siempre le ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida y por quien siempre trabaja fuertemente en búsqueda de mejores ingresos para el hogar, sin embargo, ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades que le han puesto a esforzarse cada vez más para poder sacar su hogar adelante. Para la generación de sus ingresos Ligia anteriormente tenía un criadero de pollos, el cual gracias a la buena calidad que caracterizaba sus productos lograba darle muy buena estabilidad económica, sin embargo, debido a que hace pocos meses se trasladó de vivienda por circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad, se vio en la obligación de suspender la actividad porque en la nueva vivienda ya no tenía un espacio donde pudiera tener el criadero de pollos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado poner nuevamente su criadero de pollos en un lugar de su vivienda, y por esto busca un préstamo para comprar 40 pollos y cuido de engorde para reiniciar la actividad de la crianza de pollos.

Su mayor anhelo es regresar a generar ingresos para su hogar y poder superar esta difícil etapa de su vida, de modo que su hijo pueda salir adelante teniendo acceso a una educación de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Ligia is a single mother, responsible for providing for her son, who she has always wanted to ensure a good quality of life and for whom she always works hard trying to improve the household income.  However, she has faced many adversities that have made her struggle even harder to be able to provide for her family. To generate income, Ligia previously raised chickens, and thanks to the high quality of her products, this provided her with economic stability. However, due to circumstances beyond her control she had to move house a few months ago and she was forced to give up raising chickens as there was not enough room in the new house.  With great effort, she has managed to set up a chicken run again in the new house and is therefore requesting a loan to buy 40 chickens and food to fatten them up, so that she can start raising chickens once again.

Her greatest wish is to start generating household income again and be able to get through this difficult period in her life, so that her son can benefit from having access to a high quality education.

loans.use: to buy 40 chickens and food to fatten them up, so that she can start raising chickens once again.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab runs a primary school to earn a living. She also rents houses to generate extra income. She previously acquired a loan of 60,000 KES which helped her buy chairs and tables for her school. She needs a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to build rental houses.

loans.use: To build rental houses

loans.name: Aquilla

texts.en:
Aquilla is a married woman with one child who depends on her. She is 38 years old and has been managing a sari-sari store (corner store) for 10 years in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. 

Aquilla sells items like rice, soda, and snack foods, among others, to the people in her community. She is applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stock to sell, like rice and dry goods. 

In the future, Aquilla aims to improve or expand her retailing business, thus attracting more customers, which would eventually increase her sales. Moreover, she wants her son to attend a university.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary desde muy temprana edad viene trabajando para generar sus propios ingresos, pues proviene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos, por lo que debía buscar un aporte económico para el hogar. Así, gracias a la experiencia adquirida ha logrado tener varios negocios propios que le han permitido salir adelante; primero tenía un salón de belleza, luego una miscelánea, y hace 5 años aproximadamente tiene una cafetería que montó con mucho esfuerzo y la cual le permite aportar económicamente junto con su esposo para que en su hogar tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que la cafetería la montó con muy bajo capital, no ha podido brindar a sus clientes un gran servicio que le permita captar mayor cantidad de clientes para la cafetería con mejores productos. Es por esto que ahora busca un préstamo para comprar insumos que requiere para comenzar a ofrecer desayunos y almuerzos en su cafetería.

De esta manera logrará diversificar sus ventas y cada vez logrará aumentar sus ventas, de modo que podrá tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y su familia gozará de una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
From an early age, Luz Dary has been working to earn her own income because she comes from a low-income family that needed her financial contributions. With the experience she acquired while working, she has been able to run several businesses that allowed her to get ahead: first, a beauty salon; then a general store; and for the past 5 years, a cafeteria that she opened with considerable effort and allows her to contribute financially, along with her husband, to a better life for their household. The cafeteria was opened with limited capital; therefore, she has not been able to offer the services and range of products that would attract a larger number of customers. 

So she is requesting a loan to buy needed supplies to offer breakfast and lunch in her cafeteria. This way she will be able to diversify and increase her sales so that she will have higher household income and her family will enjoy a better life and more economic opportunities for advancement.

loans.use: to buy needed supplies to offer breakfast and lunch in her cafeteria.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur, 39, is a builder who lives with his family in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as a field supervisor in a small construction company and sometimes uses his old car as a taxi after his job hours for extra profit.

Since last year, Gantumur has been building a small garage made of block bricks for his car. A month ago he started building his house and now needs to buy necessary insulation materials. His house walls will be insulated with foam, rock, wool and bricks to reduce heat loss in winter, allowing him to save on fuel.

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.

As well, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of the major contributors to Mongolian air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that operate on natural gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health.

The loan Gantumur is taking qualifies for the Green Loan program.

loans.use: to buy some building materials to make wall insulation for his house.

loans.name: Azmi

texts.en:
Azmi is a 53-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and one daughter.

For the past three years, Azmi has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but not enough to cover the costs. Azmi is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar, milk, and canned food. This will increase sales and increase Azmi's income. That will enable him to offer to his family better living conditions.

Azmi is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to resale

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim is 26 years old, married, and has a lovely young kid. He resides in Baray, Kompong Tom province. To earn a living, Rim dedicates himself to crop husbandry, planting and harvesting rice, potatoes, and vegetables for sale. From this common business, Rim can generate an average of USD 3.00 per day. He owns a few plots of farmland; however, he wants to expand his land size to ensure a high production.

In order to make a sustainable business and attain his goal, Rim would like to ask for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to supplement his capital to purchase a piece of farmland. With this expansion, he hopes that he will be able to obtain a satisfactory output from this investment.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Beltilde

texts.en:
Beltilde is married with five children. She wants the loan to buy more seeds and seed multiplication and pay labor costs so she can get the best possible harvest. She plans to use the profits to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multiplication and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en: Alisa is involved in cattle breeding. She would like to improve the living conditions for the livestock, for which she plans to renovate and expand the barn. Alisa has applied for this loan to purchase necessary construction materials to expand the barn. This will allow her not only to create better conditions for the livestock, but also to have more space and increase the number of livestock. This is important for Alisa to earn more income and meet the family's needs. Alisa lives with her husband, 2 sons and parents-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials for the barn

loans.name: Martina Esperanza

texts.es: Martina Esperanza de 62 años edad  casa con cinco hijos  mayores  tiene por actividad economica una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion , desde hace 35 años, inicio este trabajo como una oportunidad de tener un ingreso  extra ademas de su esposo que se desempeña como fotografo, ya ha tenido credito con fundacion  el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad, pretenden invertir en productos de consumo diario como: aceite, huevos, tiste, pinol, crema, azucar, pan, gaseosas, verduras entre otros.
texts.en: Martina Esperanza, 62 and married with five grown children, runs a grocery store in her home. She started her business 35 years ago to generate extra income besides that earned by her husband, who is a photographer. She has demonstrated that she is responsible in her previous loan cycle with the institution. They will buy products for daily consumption such as oil, eggs, cacao and pinole drinks, cream, sugar, bread, soft drinks, vegetables, and so forth.

loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, cacao and pinole drinks, cream, sugar, bread, soft drinks, vegetables, and so forth.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is married with four children, ages between 11 and 19. All his children go to school. His wife works as a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for three years. Eugene would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to pay school fees, and build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with four children. Evelyn is 38 years old and resides in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Evelyn buys and sells fish for a living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more fish to sell. In 2011, Evelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.en:
Bahtier is a man with a strong character. From childhood he likes to take care of cattle and that’s why 22 years ago, he began his own business. Nowadays he is busy with animal husbandry. He has a developing business. His experiences help him to be the best in business. He has big family. His wife works at the collective farm. They have three children. His wife and children help him in the business. 

Bahtier loves his family and wants to comfort them with all modern conveniences. He is going to repair his house. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials. He is waiting for your help and support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is 31 years old and lives in Cangbagsa, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with two school-age children. Cecille has a "Used Clothes" business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase two bundles of used clothes for sale. Cecille has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, Cecille hopes to expand her business and also she hopes to have some savings from the profit of her business in preparation for her children's future education especially in College.

loans.use: To purchase two bundles of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sherell

texts.en:
Sherell is married with two children.  Sherell is 29 years old and lives in Cabal-asan, Maria, Siquijor.

Sherell sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for six months in operation.  She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase assorted ingredients for her snack vending business.

Sherell has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months.  In the future, Sherell hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase assorted  ingredients for snack vending business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with two children. She is 51 years old and lives in Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Vilma has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase piglets & feed. Vilma has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

Vilma hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to purchase piglets & feed

loans.name: Mays

texts.en: Mays, a 19-year-old single lady, is the oldest sister in a family of four girls and one boy. Now a university student majoring in finance and banking, Mays wants to be a good role model for her siblings. She also wants to graduate as soon as possible to start working in the field and help the family financially. Mays is therefore requesting this loan to pay for her summer course registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her summer course registration fees.

loans.name: Merie Cris

texts.en: Merie Cris is married and a mother of three dependents. She is 39 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Merie Cris manages a retail store to earn a living. She sells assorted food products like food in pouches, coffee, milk in sachets, sugar and canned goods. She supports her family with this activity, which she has been doing for 8 years. She earns a monthly total of 10,000 PHP doing this activity. She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Merie Cris has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Merie Cris hopes to add a new retail shop in the market and gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married with five school-age children. Salvacion is 45 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Salvacion engages in a dress-making business. She has had this business for 9 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase assorted clothes for her dress-making business. Salvacion has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.

In the future, Salvacion hopes to sustain her business and be able to allocate savings to deposit for her children`s future education.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothes for dress-making business

loans.name: Dancilla

texts.en:
Dancilla is married. She has three children aged between 6 and 16 years. She wants the loan to buy more seeds and seed multiplication and pay labor costs so she can get the best harvest. She plans to use the profits to renovate her house. In the future, she would like to see her agriculture business prospering.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multiplication and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is from Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Calamba. She is 50 years old and is married. Violeta prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been in her business for eight years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Violeta joined GDMPC. 

Violeta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make cooked food. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make cooked food.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is married with two children. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication and pay labor costs so he can get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to reinvest in the maize farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multiplication and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Veronica De La Concepcion

texts.es: Verónica de la concepción tiene 36 años de edad con dos hijos esta emprendedora inicio su  actividad económica desde hace 20 años  cómo  es Bar y restaurante ofreciéndoles a sus cliente servicios de comideria, gaseosa, jugos  y licores nacionales e internacionales. El financiamiento lo está solicitando para invertir en la compra de licores, jugos, gaseosas, carne, arroz y los ingredientes para cosinar etc.
texts.en: Verónica de la Concepción is 36, and has two children. Twenty years ago, this entrepreneur started her bar and restaurant business, offering customers prepared foods, soft drinks, juices, and local and international liquors. The funding she is requesting will be used to buy liquors, juices, soft drinks, rice, cooking ingredients, etc.

loans.use: to buy: liquors, juices, soft drinks, rice, cooking ingredients, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and lives in Candanay Norte, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with two adult-aged children. 
 
Gloria engaged in a backyard piggery project. She is a government employee.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to use for training expenses of her son's upgrading course as a seaman.  

Gloria has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  In the future, Gloria hopes to see her son complete his studies and soon be able to help the family.

loans.use: To pay for training expenses of her son for upgrading course as seaman

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is married. She has six children between 9 and 18 years. She wants the loan for buying more seeds and supporting her labor costs so that she can get the best harvest possible. She plans to use the profits to provide food for her family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and support her labor costs

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is still running her trading business. Thanks to her business she was able to pay for her son’s education and to repair her apartment; also she supports her family with business income. Now Zhanna’s son has a job and he helps his mother to support their family. 

Zhanna used her first Kiva loan to buy a large lot of swimsuits to resell. Now she is also asking for a $ 3,000 loan to buy men’s and women’s swimsuits and underclothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy men’s and women’s swimsuits and underclothes to resell

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Jose Francisco casado ,con hijos mayores de edad, tiene por actividad economica el servicio de desgrane de maiz trillado de arroz, tiempo de tener el negocio 9 años, el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion. Dicha actividad la inicio por una herencia de su papa el cual era el dueño del negocio al llegar a la mayoria de edad se lo sedio para seguirlo trabajando, en la actualidad implemto el trillo de arroz ya que la zona dode vive lo tiene como un negocio de mayor actividad, el objectivo del prestamo es para invertir en el techo donde esta ubicado el trillo y desgranadora, ya que de esa forma le ayudaria el programa kiva para mejorar la condidiciones para dar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Jose Francisco is married and his children are no longer minors. To earn a living, he provides corn husking and rice threshing services. He has run this business for nine years, and it is located at his home. He inherited this business from his father who previously owned it. When Jose Francisco reached an age of majority, his father handed it over to him so that it would keep going. He currently uses the rice threshing machine, as it generates more business in the area where he lives. 
The aim of the loan is to invest in the roof under which the threshing machine and the husker are located. So, the Kiva program would thus help him to improve the conditions under which he provides these services.

loans.use: to invest  in the roof under which the threshing machine and the husker are located.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is from D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Virgilia is married and has three children. She plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from it. In 2010, Virgilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en:
Musharaf has a large family. From first loan later 4 years that's why her children become elder and also she birthed a child. Now,she has four children from 22 to 30 years old. She loves, supports and always cares about her children. She also gives advice and supports them in their work. Her whole life she has been teaching them to be hardworking and purposeful people. Musharaf has changed her kind of business. 

Nowadays she is busy with cattle breeding and selling of bakery products in the Kistakuz and Kanibadam regions. Her loving husband always helps her as a friend and advises her every time. 

The number of her family is increasing from year to year, and that's why the parents are thinking about expanding their house. Musharaf is requesting a loan for buying building materials for renovating her house. She hopes for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Perpetue

texts.en:
Perpetue is married. She has three children aged between five and fifteen. Two of them attend school. She wants this loan to pay for more seeds, seed multiplication, and support labor to get the best harvest. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for more seeds, seed multiplication, and support labor.

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en:
Annonciatha is married. She has three children aged between 10 and 20, all of whom attend school. She wants the loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs to get the best harvest. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for the children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is married. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 6 years. He would like to get this loan to buy and harvest seeds and to pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy and harvest seeds and to pay for support labor.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy de 46 años de edad, casado  con un hijo mayor de edad, tiene por actividad economica  una librería  ubicada en su casa de habitacion , actividad que la inico desde hace 5 años , negocio que inico como una alternativa de trabajo que pudiera atender su hijo cuando no estubiera estudiando, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar  equipo de trabajo y productos como. Vitrinas, estantes, libros, lapiceros, cuadernos, papel lustrio , folder, marcadores, resaltadores, broches de archivos, engrapadoras, calculadoras, saca grapas.  entre otros
texts.en:
46-year old Freddy is married and has an adult son. He earns his living running a bookstore from his house, a business he's had for five years. Freddy started his business as an alternative to a regular job so that his son could help in the store when he wasn't studying.

The loan he is seeking will be used to buy work tools and products such as display cabinets, shelves, books, pencils, notebooks, glossy paper, folders, markers, highlighters, file fasteners, staple removers, calculators etc.

loans.use: To buy display cabinets, shelves, books, pencils, notebooks, glossy paper, folders, markers, highlighters, file fasteners, staple removers, calculators etc.

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en:
Byambadorj is a 34-year-old married man who lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia (an area that lacks basic infrastructure). He supports his family by operating a clothing sale business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

His wife helps him, while their elder son attends local primary school and their cousin babysits their daughter. Now, Byambadorj has 2.9 million Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. He usually sells men's and women's clothes and blankets. In July, Mongolians celebrate the great traditional holiday Naadam, so Byambadorj needs more clothes to sell for the upcoming holiday.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell for an upcoming traditional Mongolian holiday, Naadam.

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. 

Najla has been a tailor since 2009; she makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats and trousers for women and kids. She has  sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well-known in the surrounding areas. 

She is requesting a $2500 loan to purchase two sewing machines and a generator. She aims to make more money to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines and a generator.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is very hardworking woman. Her friends know her as gentle, cute and good-natured. She always tries to find new ways of making income. She has a very difficult life as her husband went to Russia for finding a job. Rahima must feed and sustain her family alone. She is busy with animal husbandry and it is her way of getting money. 

She wants to repair her house but hasn't enough money; that's why she is asking for a loan to buy building materials. She awaits your help and support. If you will help her she'll improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Mabomba Mengi Group

texts.en:
Balozi, who is in his late 30s, is married with four children. Two of them go to school and two of them are still young. He has been a tailor and also has been selling second-hand TVs, radios, DVD decks and speakers since 1999. He works from 7:00 am to 8:30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling his second-hand products, paid school fees, made bricks, and for household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more second-hand TV sets, radios, DVD decks and speakers to resell. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house. 

Balozi will share this loan with his loan group "Mabomba Mengi" with 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand TV sets, radios, DVD decks and speakers to resell.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of three children. Five years ago, she opened up a convenience store selling a variety of foodstuffs, soft drinks, kitchen utensils and detergents. Over the years, Zeinab expanded her scope of work and increased her revenue generation by adding clothing to her offerings. 

Zeinab is applying for a loan from Kiva's Partner, Al Majmoua, which she will invest in increasing her supplies of foodstuffs and apparel. She will specifically focus on women's and children's clothing which seem to have high demand in her area. With the availability of the necessary capital, Zeinab will be able to employ her trade knowledge, experience and good reputation to achieve her business expansion and growth plans.

loans.use: to increase her supplies of foodstuffs and apparel

loans.name: Azizmoh

texts.en: Azizmoh is a woman who has the best qualities of people; she is very kind and clever. Azizmoh has a high degree and she is a teacher. Her income isn't  enough for feeding or keeping her family and that’s why she has her own business deal. She is busy with animal husbandry. In this business too, Azizmoh helps her husband. They have an 11-year-old son. Azizmoh wants to do all her best for her son. She wants to develop her business to buy young cattle, but her income isn’t enough. She awaits your help and support. If you will help her, she would be happy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for a developing business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto desde hace varios años a recibido el apoyo de nuestra empresa para el mejoramiento continuo de su vivienda y ahora necesita acondicionar la cocina enjarrandola, poniendole piso y pintandola. Actualmente esta pensionado por parte del instituto mexicano del seguro social ya que hace algunos años sufrió dos embolias que lo dejaron incapacitado para trabajar, el trabajaba en ferrocarriles mexicanos; dio gran parte de su vida a trabajar, ahora su esposa se esfuerza por sacara su familia adelante y que su esposo se sienta orgulloso de tener a una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que no se da por vencida y que a pesar de las circunstancias ella lo apoyara en todo.  Su esposa trabaja en una tienda en Laredo Texas como gerente de personal.
texts.en:
For several years now Roberto has received assistance from our organization to make continuous  improvements to his home. Now he needs to renovate his kitchen, plaster it,  put in a floor, and paint it.

Roberto currently receives a pension from Mexican Social Security as several years ago he got blood clots which left him unable to work at his job on the railways. A big part of his life was spent working; now his wife has to shoulder much of the work to help the family get ahead. He is proud of having such a hardworking enterprising wife who gives her all. In spite of the difficult circumstances she helps him with everything. She works in Laredo Texas as a personnel manager.

loans.use: To buy supplies to plaster, paint and put in a floor in his kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: La Victorine Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bachinane est membre du le groupement  d’affaire Victorine, elle est mariée et mère de 3 jeunes enfants. Son mari commissionnaire dans un comptoir de pierres précieuses (minerais). La cliente est vendeuse de boissons Primus. Elle est sociétaire d’un petit Nganda (bistro), organisée à son  domicile. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 casiers de Primus et 2 casiers d’Amstel. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: Bachinane is a member of the business group Victorine. She is married and has three young children. Her husband is a doorman for a store selling precious stones (minerals). Bachinane sells Primus beer. She is the shareholder of a small Nganda (bistro) that is located in her home. She used her own savings to start the business. Later, she sought help from the micro-finance institution Hekima. This new loan will enable her to buy two cases of Primus beer and two cases of Amstel beer. For this, she would like to thank Hekima for its support and for empowering female small-business owners. It should be noted that one of the group members is holding a baby.

loans.use: to buy 2 cases of Primus beer and 2 cases of Amstel beer

loans.name: José Rómulo

texts.es: José Romulo aprendió a trabajar con el café desempeñándose primero como jornalero hasta que con el paso del tiempo pudo ahorrar dinero y comprar su propio terreno para así convertirse en productor de café desde hace 38 años. Actualmente José Romulo tiene una producción anual de 10 toneladas de café orgánico, la cuales vende a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que sean exportadas. Una de las preocupaciones que él tiene actualmente es realizar todo los procesos que involucran al café de manera más técnica, ya que así podrá aprovechar mejor los recursos con que cuenta y también logrará una mejor conservación del medio ambiente y su terreno. Para comenzar a llevar a cabo está acción necesita hacer labores de limpieza y preparación de una parte de sus finca y para ello necesita un crédito. A José Romulo en un futuro le gustaría poder ampliar su casa y construir otra para uno de sus hijos. También le gustaría en unos años poder tener un buen patrimonio para cuando tenga que retirarse.
texts.en:
José Romulo learned to work with coffee by first working as a day worker.  He did that until, as time passed, he was able to save money and buy his own land.  He did this 38 years ago in order to become a coffee producer.

José Romulo now produces ten tons of organic coffee annually.  He sells it to the Unión Regional de Huatusco to be exported.  One of the concerns that he now has is performing all of the most technical processes involved with coffee.  This way he would be able to take better advantage of the resources he has.  He would also manage better conservation of the environment and his land.

In order to begin to carry out this action he needs to do cleaning work and to prepare part of his farm.  He needs a loan to do this.  In the future José Romulo would like to be able to expand his house and built another one for his children.  In a few years he would also like to be able to have good assets for when he has to retire.

loans.use: to clean his land and prepare it for planting.

loans.name: Raghad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. Raghad is a youth client, aged 23 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Raghad has a women's beauty salon. She recently opened her business in 2012. But she has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and she knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

Raghad is requesting a youth loan of $1,800 to decorate her salon. She is aiming to grow her business and develop her skills so she will be able to provide better support to her family.

loans.use: to decorate her salon.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 24-year-old single man and has been running his father’s automobile spare parts business for more than six years now. His work comprises buying used cars, breaking them down into parts, fixing them if needed, and selling them to his customers. Husein has succeeded in building on his father’s reputation and developing his own. He has good relationships with his clients and neighbors, offering them courteous and quality service with competitive prices.

To keep his business running and to further expand it, Husein needs to ensure the consistent availability of spare parts at his workshop. For this purpose, he is applying for a youth loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his stock of used cars and invest his time in breaking them down into parts. Husein already has had a positive experience in his first loan cycle with Al Majmoua, which contributed to the continuity of his business.

loans.use: to ensure the consistent availability of spare parts at his auto workshop

loans.name: Dukorerehamwe Group

texts.fr:
A.  Marie  fait partie du groupe Dukorerehamwe, et habite à  Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 54 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de Restaurant  (haricot, riz, huile de palme,…) depuis 12 ans.

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité des produits vivriers (haricot, riz, huile de palme,…) à revendre cuits dans son restaurant.  

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait   poursuivre son commerce de restaurant en le développant.
texts.en:
A. Marie lives in Bujumbura and is a member of the Dukorerehamwe group. She is a 54-year-old widow.

She has been running a restaurant for 12 years (beans, rice, palm oil, etc).

She is requesting her seventh loan from the micro-finance institution Turame. She will use the loan obtained through Kiva to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of food crops (beans, rice, palm oil, etc) that she will cook and sell in her restaurant.

In the coming years, she would like to build and develop her restaurant business.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many items for her restaurant (beans, rice, palm oil, etc) that she will cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Abed El Amir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. Abed El Amir is 58 years old, married, and has two children.

Abed El Amir has owned a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, dairy products, and detergents. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and he knows about their demands. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 in order to buy a generator and two refrigerators and to install shelves in his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and two refrigerators and to install shelves in his shop.

loans.name: Monrovian Group

texts.en:
Asma, who is in her late 30s, is married and has one child who goes to school.  She has had a retail shop for two years now. She works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Asma used the previous loans to restock the missing items in her shop, buy a TV set and a radio, and to pay school fees, and she has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her retail shop inventory. Her dream is to one day have a very big retail shop.

Asma will share this loan with her loan group "Monrovian," which has 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 44-year-old man. He is married and a father of five sons and three daughters. His elder son is a worker and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover his needs.

Adel has had a barber shop, which has been a profitable project, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the costs of work.

Adel is requesting a US $3,000 loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new barber kit, which includes hair and body creams, hair dryers, hair brushes, chairs and mirrors, and to add some new decorations. This will improve the quality of Adel's work and improve the condition of the barber shop, which will help to increase Adel's income.

Adel is photographed in his barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new barber kit and add some new decorations

loans.name: Bineta's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 28 décembre 2011. Les membres habitent le même quartier et exercent toutes la même activité qu'est le petit commerce de draps et habits pour hommes. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main la responsable est âgée de 62 ans 

Elle est une veuve et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons et 04 filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète des pièces de tissus et des produits pour la teinture.

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettront de renforcer ses épargnes et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group was founded on 28 December 2011. The members live in the same neighbourhood and are all involved in the same business activity, namely the small trade of bed linen and menswear.

The leader of the group is 62 years old. She is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised.

She is a widow and has 06 children including 02 boys and 04 girls.

She will use the loan to buy pieces of fabric and products for dying material.

The profits she generates with her activity will enable her to increase her savings and meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric and dye in order to make bed linen and menswear for resale.

loans.name: Gladys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gladys se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 16 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos para el hogar trabaja junto con su esposo en una venta de legumbres y verduras que tienen ubicada en el parque principal de su municipio. El negocio ya tiene varios años funcionando y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes que le permiten tener unas muy buenas ventas y por ende unos ingresos para su hogar. Con su negocio han logrado salir adelante brindándoles a sus 2 hijos una educación de buena calidad y una buena estabilidad económica, por esto trabajan fuertemente en el para conservarlo y seguir haciéndolo crecer para progresar económicamente.
