As a mother of two and head of the household due to her separation some time ago, Rocio must guarantee her household income so that she can help her two children get ahead and provide them access to a quality education.  She has a fruit crop where she has been working for 12 years.  Thanks to the experience she has gained, she’s managed to gain a large number of motivated clients, mainly because of the quality of products that she offers.  Since she has a large number of requests from her customers, Rocio is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer, irrigation, insecticides, and other things to help advance her harvest.

In this way she can continue to generate the income that her household needs in order to have a good quality of life and continue to be financially stable so that she can get ahead.  Her greatest dream is to have a great business that will allow her to get ahead and provide stability for her two children.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido las fuerzas para salir adelante y continuar progresando junto con su familia. Casado y con un hijo de 10 años de edad, Rigoberto tiene una tienda general desde hace 10 años la cual es la fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su familia, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes, sus ventas siguen aumentando. Es por esto que como no cuenta con un capital que le permita solventar el crecimiento de su negocio, Rigoberto busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su negocio con productos que ya se han ido agotando. 

Su mayor sueño es seguir con su negocio y que este le permita darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Además, en un futuro espera poder realizar mejoras locativas y así tener una tienda más amplia para ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
Rigoberto has had to face many adversities in life; however, he has always had the strength to succeed and to continue to make progress along with his family. He is married with a 10 year old son: Rigoberto has run a general store for 10 years and this has been his source of income for meeting his family expenses. Owing to the high quality of his products and the good customer service that he provides, his level of sales has continued to increase. As he has no capital to invest, and nothing which would allow him to attain any funds to grow his business, Rigoberto is looking for a loan which will allow him to buy products to fulfill his customers weekly shopping requirements, so that he can re-stock his business with products that have already sold out.
His ultimate dream is to continue running his business, and this will allow him to provide his family with a good standard of living and better economic opportunities for progress. Furthermore, in the future he hopes to be able to carry out improvements to his shop and, consequently, have a larger shop offering a greater range of products.

loans.use: To buy products to fulfill his customers weekly shopping requirements so that he can fill his shop with products that have already sold out.

loans.name: Yaneth Lucía

texts.es:
Yaneth es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, y para esto tiene un negocio de producción y venta de calzado con el cual puede generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar. Con su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos, brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de buena calidad, por esto siempre busca que su negocio siga creciendo y así pueda tener mejores oportunidades económicas en su hogar. Gracias a que sus productos son muy reconocidos, los pedidos por parte de sus clientes cada vez vienen aumentando, sin embargo, presenta la dificultad de no contar con el material necesario para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes. Es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar una máquina pulidora y materias primas para la elaboración de los pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es seguir con su negocio y que este le permita brindarles a sus 2 hijos una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a single mother and head of household for her two children to whom she has always wished to provide a good quality life. So she has a business making and selling footwear with which she can generate the income required by her household. With her business she has been able to get ahead and get her children ahead, offering them a better quality life and quality education. So she has always tried to keep growing her business so her household may be in a better financial situation. Because her products are well-known her customers' orders have been increasing. However, the difficulty has arisen of not having the necessary materials in order to fill her customers' orders. So she is seeking a loan which would allow her to purchase a polishing machine and raw materials for making the footwear ordered by her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to keep her business going and that it would allow her to offer her two children a good quality of life and better financial opportunities in order to progress.

loans.use: to purchase a polishing machine and raw materials for fulfilling her customers' orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a heated food display cabinet that will let her increase her capacity to satisfy all her customers' demand

loans.name: Khodeir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. Khodeir is 55 years old, married, and has one child. The owner of a bakery since 1994, he produces and sells flour-based food such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies, all baked in ovens. He has sufficient experience in this field and knows about the clients’ demands. Enjoying a good reputation, he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Khodeir is requesting this $1800 loan in order to install a new ceramic floor for the bakery. He is aiming to develop his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a new ceramic floor for the bakery.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: El Sr. Ignacio de cuarenta y tres años es  casado  y padre de tres hijos trabaja como técnico de mantenimiento  en  una estación de radio de la localidad, vive en una casa de interés social desde hace seis años, Ignacio tiene muchos sueños por realizar pero le da mayor importancia a dos el primero en orden de importancia es mantener unida a su familia y brindarles una carrea profesional a sus hijos considera que es la mejor herencia que él como padre podría dejarles y el segundo es construir un patrimonio solido para él y su esposa ya que esta consiente que sus hijos algún día tendrán que formar su propia familia y partir de su lado; Ignacio construyo un cuarto en el cual actualmente habita su hijo pero a este le falta acabados interiores y exteriores tales como enjarre, pintura y techo solicita el apoyo para realizar estas mejoras y agradece el apoyo brindado para la realización de estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio, 43, is married and the father of three children. He works as a maintenance technician at a local radio station. He lives in publically subsidized housing where he has been for six years. Ignacio has many dreams he wants to make come true, but he gives greater importance to two of them: first in order of importance is to keep his family close-knit and provide a professional education to his children. He believes this is the best inheritance he as a father can give them. Second, is to build a solid net worth for him and his wife since he is aware that some day his children will form their own families and leave his side. 

Ignacio built a bedroom which his son currently inhabits; however, it lacks finished walls in the interior and exterior such as plaster, paint and roofing. He is seeking the support in order to carry out these improvements and appreciates the support offered for carrying out these improvements.

loans.use: to make improvements to his living quarters.

loans.name: La Chispa  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal La Chispa. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades. Ellos al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse y formar este banco comunal el cual les va a servir de mucho para mejorar sus negocios.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Jazmín, tiene 36 años  de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro  hijos de años de 19, 18,  11  y 4  años de edad, las dos mayores estudian en universidad y los dos menores en colegio y jardín de infantes. Su marido es taxista.

Nuestra amiga además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, carteras, zapatillas, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta nos cuenta que sale a recorrer de lunes a viernes ya sea en las mañanas o tardes, ella deja  sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Para comprar su mercadería y surtirse de productos se traslada hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil Y también le envían mercadería desde los Estados Unidos ya que allá tiene familiares, tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatillas, carteras y otros productos que ella vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco años pero en otro grupo pero ahora formo este grupo y espera seguir por mucho más tiempo.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en: In the city of Portoviejo, capital city of Manabi, the partners of the communal bank La Chispa, get together every 15 days. They do diverse activities such as general commerce, services, among others, for a living. When they heard of the benefits the institution could provide them, they decided to get together and create this communal bank, which will help them a lot to improve their businesses. Here we met Jazmín, who is 36 years old, is married and has 4 children from this relationship. Her children are 19, 18, 11 and 4 years old. The two older ones are studying in the university and the two younger ones are in school and kindergarten. Her husband drives a taxi. Our friend, apart from being a great housewife, also sells clothes of all kinds, like handbags and sneakers, among others. She sells door-to-door. She walks around selling from Monday to Friday, in the mornings or in the afternoons. She leaves the products on credit and she collects the money every week. To buy her merchandise and get supplies of products, she travels to the city of Guayaquil and they also send her merchandise from the United States, since she has family there. She has been doing this activity for 3 years and is doing very well. She will use this loan to buy clothes, sneakers, handbags and other products that she sells. She has been a part of the communal bank for five years, but in another group, now she created this group and she hopes to continue there for a long time. Her dream is that her children can have a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sneakers, handbags, etc

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 27-year-old married woman caring for three children. Her husband is a tailor.

To help in improving their living conditions, Lina chose to start making homemade pickles to sell to neighbors and friends.

She wants to start making a larger quantity so she can provide to restaurants close by and food stores, so she has applied for this loan to get more jars in different sizes.

loans.use: to get more jars in different sizes.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 34 años, está casada con Carlos, con quien tiene cinco hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Pampas. 
Durante las mañanas dedica su tiempo a cuidar de su casa y de sus hijos, pero por las tardes comienza llevando el almuerzo a su esposo que trabaja en la tienda de venta de repuestos para motocicletas que abrieron hace 8 meses. Antes su esposo trabajaba como mecánico arreglando los problemas técnicos de las motocicletas, con el tiempo convenció a su esposa de poder vender repuestos para obtener mejores ganancias. De esa manera, ellos trabajan juntos en todo este tiempo y ha obtenido buenos ingresos, pues es la única que se dedica a este rubro en su zona, además, en la ciudad, la mayoría de las personas tiene una motocicleta, por ello es rentable su negocio. 

Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y en todo este tiempo pudo solventar algunas necesidades de su negocio gracias al apoyo financiero obtenido. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere fallar a los miembros de su asociación, que son personas responsables.
Luz invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de diversos repuestos para motocicletas, de esa manera abastecerá su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 34 years old and married to Carlos with whom she has five children whom she cares for in their own home located in the locality of Pampas. In the mornings she devotes herself to caring for the home and her children, but in the afternoons she begins by taking lunch to her husband who works in the motorcycle parts store they opened up eight months ago. Previously her husband was working as a mechanic fixing tecnical problems in motorcycles. Over time he convinced his wife they could sell parts in order to make better earnings. In this way they worked together this whole time and have made a good income since it is the only shop of its type in the area. Furthermore, in the city most people have a motorcycle so the business is profitable. 

This is the second loan she has had with MFP and during this time she was able to cover for some necessities in the business thanks to the financial support she received. So she promises to make her payments promptly, since she does not wish to fail the members of her association who are responsible persons. 

Luz will invest the money she sought in the purchase of a variety of motorcycle repair parts so as to stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of spare parts for motorcycles to stock her business.

loans.name: Seyhun

texts.en:
Seyhun is a 32-year-old man. He is married with two children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in an IDP Settlement.  

He is a mechanical engineer and does car engineering and car repair. He has five years of experience in the service field. His wife is a teacher in the local school. Seyhun`s father helps him, too, because he is also an engineer. 

Seyhun's monthly income is 100 AZN. He applied for 600 AZN to purchase modern car repair tools and improve the quality of service he provides to customers.

loans.use: to buy new car repair tools to improve service quality.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Дильбаре 37 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей, младшей из которых 1 год . Дильбар в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 14 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Дильбар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с приплодом, 25 овец, продажа молока приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц. Также, Дильбар возделывает 0,66 га земли с картофелем и эспарцетом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дильбар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительного скота для отправки на летнее пастбище.  Доходы от кредита Дильбар будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, в будущем планирует дать образование своим детям.
texts.en:
Dilbar is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children, the youngest of whom is 1 year old. As the main source of income for her family, Dilbar has been raising livestock for the past 14 years, having started her business with 10,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Dilbar's herd currently includes 3 cows with offspring and 25 sheep, while sales of milk bring roughly 8,000 som per month. Dilbar also works 0.66 hectares of land with potatoes and sainfoin.

In order to continue developing her business, Dilbar has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock, which she will send to a summer pasture. Dilbar plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, so as to be able to provide education for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
A 36-year-old married father of three sons, Natiq is an IDP living with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as meat to local butchers. Natiq has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle.

Natiq usually buys calves, raising and fattening them in 5-6 months, then reselling them to butchers from his house. Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. His total income per month is180 AZN. His products are very popular in Azerbaijan, as people use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma. As well, people always use yoghurt, considered a very healthy food.

In order to increase his income to cover the basic needs of his beloved children, Natiq is requesting a loan of 600 AZN to purchase three head of cattle, one milk cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle, one milk cow, and fodder.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 24 years old. He is married but still doesn’t have children.

Kasem is a hairdresser for men and has owned a barber shop since 2011. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for $2,500 as a “Youth loan” to pay the annual rent for the shop and buy new shaving supplies. He is aiming to develop his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop and buy new shaving supplies.

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in his barber shop.

Tahreer is a 30-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to five daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Tahreer's husband has had a barber shop, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover its costs.

Tahreer is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new barber kit such as: hair creams, hair dryers and brushes, different types of scissors; also improving the shop's condition, such as painting and installing lights. 

This will improve the shop's condition and improve the quality of work, which will help to increase the family's income and help them live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new barber kit and make some improvements to the shop.

loans.name: Hayrullo

texts.ru: Хайрулло был очень талантливый с самого детства. У него трое детей и он строго следит за их воспитанием. Он  работает сварщиком  более трёх лет. Там он арендовал помещения, снабдил всем необходимым и продолжает предоставлять свои услуги. До этого у него была своя точка  где он тоже хорошо работал. Где бы, он не работал, он показывает свою качественную работу и общение. Займ  ему необходим , чтобы приобрести более современные оборудования. С помощью этого ему бы хотелось, разнообразит  свои услуги в сфере обслуживания. Хайрулло ждёт вашей помощи.
texts.en:
Hayrullo has three children and keeps a sharp eye on their education. Since his early childhood, Hayrullo has shown great talent. For over three years, he has been working as a welder. He currently rents space for his workshop, which he has outfitted with all the necessary equipment to provide his services. Previously, he worked from a different location, where his business also went well. No matter where he works, Hayrullo demonstrates high quality of his work and good social skills.

Hayrullo needs this loan to purchase more modern equipment, with whose help he will be able to expand the range of services he offers. Hayrullo is awaiting your help.

loans.use: to buy new welding equipment in order to develop his business

loans.name: Badura

texts.en:
Badura is 39-year-old woman, married, with three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is farmer, raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has 12 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in raising these crops.
 
Badura usually sells her crop from her yard.  People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma.  Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan households and also make fresh punch.  Badura's monthly income is 130 AZN.  Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for women.  That is why her husband helps Badura. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly sales.  For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN.  This will be her second loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru:
Гулзада родилась в многодетной простой семье скотника. Она была младшей дочерью, и поэтому большую часть времени посвящала домашним хлопотам: так как старшие сестры вышли замуж, братья женились и отделились от родителей, занималась домашней работой и небольшим хозяйством. По окончании школы Гулзада поступила в ВУЗ и отучившись, приехала в родное село, где вышла замуж. 1990 году в семье Гулзады родилась старшая дочка, а затем и трое сыновей. С увеличением состава семьи, росли потребности  и нужды. Чтобы прокормить и обеспечить всем необходимым своих детей, Гулзада  начала выходить на рынок торговать овощами и фруктами.
Параллельно, на дому уже вместе с мужем Гулзада начала свой бизнес в разведении скота, купив для начала дойную корову для получения молока. Успешно положив начало, Гулзада смогла купить бычков -  хозяйство разрасталось за счет приплода скота. Со временем, продав часть скота, Гулзада смогла купить дом и машину для семьи. В данное время Гулзада с мужем полностью заняты животноводством – на сегодня в хозяйстве Гулзады имеется 3 бычка и 2 барана. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзада обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум  и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Старшая дочь Гульзады учится в Школе милиции, и в планах Гулзады -  увеличение поголовья скота, чтоб иметь возможность определить на учебу и младших сыновей.
texts.en: Gulzada was born into a large farming family.  She was the youngest daughter and, hence, devoted a lot of time to household duties.  Because her older sisters and brother got married and separated from the parents, she was involved in household and farming work.  After finishing school, Gulzada was accepted to a university and came back to her native village after her graduation, where she got married.  Her oldest daughter was born in 1990 and then three sons.  The family needs increased with its growing size.  In order to feed and provide her children with all necessities, Gulzada started to go to a market to sell vegetables and fruits.  Parallel to this, Gulzada and her husband have already started their own business of breeding livestock by initially buying a dairy cow for producing milk.  With this successful start, Gulzada was able to buy bulls, and the business grew due to the addition of offspring.  With time, having sold some of the livestock, Gulzada was able to buy a house and a car for her family.  At the present time, she and her husband are fully involved in animal husbandry.  Today, their business contains three bulls and two rams.  In order to further develop her business, Gulzada requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock.  Gulzada's oldest daughter is attending a Police School, and Gulzada's plans are to increase livestock headcount in order to be able to educate her younger sons as well.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Xumar

texts.en:
Xumar is a 40-year-old woman. She is married with four children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Xumar has been breeding sheep and cows for the last ten years. Her husband`s salary is 140 AZN, which is not enough to cover the needs of four children. She decided to start her business, and with the help of her father, who was breeding animals for his entire life, they purchased her first cattle.

Xumar usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 3-5 months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 900 AZN. Mutton and beef are in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use them in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Xumar also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase ten sheep, one milking cow, and fodder.  This will be her second loan from AqroInvest CU and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep, one milking cow, and fodder.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en: Abdusalom is very careful father and lovely husband. He tries to comfort his family with all modern conveniences. He is also a good business man. 15 years ago he began his own business. He is busy with selling dried fruits. He has his own 0.8 hectare fruit garden. There are many fruit trees. Abdusalom's children and wife help him in his business. They prepare dried fruits from fresh fruits and then sell them. Abdusalom wants to develop his business, that’s why he is asking for a loan for processing dried fruits. Abdusalom and his family want your help.

loans.use: To process dried fruits.

loans.name: Muslum

texts.en:
Muslum is a 42-year-old man, married with five children. He is IDP (an internally dispaced person) and lives with his family in IDP Settlement. He is an auto repair engineer and has 15 years of experience in this field. He usually repairs Russian cars and his customers are people from the same settlement where Russian cars are very popular, because they are cheap. His monthly income is 60 AZN and he gets financial support from the government. 

He applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to make renovations to his workplace and buy new tools.

loans.use: to buy new tools and make renovation

loans.name: Shamiykul

texts.ru:
Шайымкул 59 лет, вдова, имеет 5 детей. Шайымкул во времена Советского Союза работала дояркой в колхозе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, 22 года назад начала заниматься животноводством, стартовав  бизнес с суммы в 8,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Шайымкул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  9 коров с приплодом, 19 овец, продажа молока приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шайымкул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Часть доходов от кредита Шайымкул будет вкладывать в постройку дома для сына, который является человеком с ограниченными возможностями.
texts.en: Shamiykul is 59 years old, a widow and has five children.  During the time of the Soviet Union, she worked as a milkmaid at a collective farm and, to provide an additional source of income for her family, became involved in animal husbandry 22 years ago, having started this business with a sum of 8,000 som.  Thanks to Shamiykul's hard work, today her business contains nine cows with offspring and nineteen sheep, and the sales of milk yield about 15,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Shamiykul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock.  She plans to invest part of the earnings from the loan into building a house for her son, who has limited means.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: A.n.m.o Group

texts.en:
Mariam (3rd from the left) is a 26-year-old married woman and mother of one son. She is the featured borrower of ANMO Group. For four years now, she has been working as a hairdresser, based at home. Besides this service, Mariam also sells women's clothing and handmade handicrafts and decorations. 

She got together with the other members of her group, Najah, Oussama, and Amani (from left to right) to apply for a Group loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua. Mariam will use the money from the loan to buy a nail care tool for $100 and will use part of the remaining amount to buy hair colorants. She will invest the rest of the loan in printing business cards, brochures, and pricing manuals. 

Previously, Mariam suffered from the informality with customers; she was always embarrassed to ask for the right prices from her neighbors and friends, consequently incurring losses in her business. With a fixed pricing manual, Mariam will finally overcome this problem. 

With her good reputation in the area, her quality service, and accumulated savings, Mariam seeks to open her own hairdressing salon, independent from home, in the future.

loans.use: to buy a nail care tool for $100 and use part of the remaining amount to buy hair colorants.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон 23 года, замужем, воспитывает трех детей. Чолпон с 2007  года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 4,000 сом, израсходованных на покупку овец. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  4 овцы, плодоносящий сад - 8 корней абрикоса и 30 корней смородины. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Cholpon is 23 years old, married, and is raising three children. Since 2007, Cholpon has been engaged in animal husbandry, having started her business with 4,000 som, which she used to purchase sheep. Thanks to her hard work, Cholpon's farm currently has 4 sheep and an orchard with 8 apricot trees and 30 currant bushes.

In order to continue developing her business, Cholpon has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas is married, with three children, aged between 6 and 12; all three children attend schools. He is a maize farmer, and so is his wife.  Didas has been a maize farmer for 22 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds and seed multipliers and hire support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to build a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product; generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multipliers and hire support labor

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru:
Гулькаир 36 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. В период с 2005 по 2011 год, из-за отсутствия каких-либо доходов,  Гулькаир с мужем была вынуждена уехать на заработки в Россию,  где она бралась за любую работу. Благодаря упорному труду они смогли накопить определенную сумму денег и вернутся на родину.  По приезду, Гулькаир купила дом , 10 голов овец на откорм и перепродажу и устроилась на работу в местную школу.   Сейчас Гулькаир работает учителем истории в школе  и ждет третьего ребенка.  На сегодня в хозяйстве Гулькаир насчитывается 38 овец, ежемесячная прибыль с продажи мясных продуктов составляет 8,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулькаир обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку клевера.  Доходы от кредита Гулькаир планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulkaiyr is 36 years old, married, and raising 2 children. From 2005 to 2011, lacking any source of income, Gulkaiyr and her husband were forced to go to find work in Russia, where Gulkaiyr took any available job. Thanks to their hard work, the couple were able to save up enough money to return to their homeland. Upon arrival, Gulkaiyr bought a house and 10 sheep for fattening and resale, and found a job at a local school. Presently, she works as a history teacher while awaiting the birth of her third child. Her herd presently consists of 38 sheep, and sales of meat bring roughly 8,000 som per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Gulkaiyr has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase clover. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her sheep

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is a 43-year-old widow and raises two daughters alone. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is farmer, raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has about 12 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person with these crops.
 
Nigar usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetable, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan households and also make fresh punch.  Nigar's monthly income is 900 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for women, and that is why her mother helps Nigar. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raise and increase her monthly sales.  For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. This will be her third loan, and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Sarana

texts.en:
Sarana is a 39-year-old widow, with one son.  She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives in an IDP Settlement. She is a farmer, raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has about 10 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person with these crops. 

Sarana usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan households and also make fresh punch.  Sarana's monthly income is 80 AZN.  Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for women.  That why her son helps Sarana. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly sales.  For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This will be her third loan, and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora. Está casada con Walter, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero sólo viven con tres de ellos. Su casa es propia y se ubica en la localidad de Pampas. 
Durante las primeras horas del día se levanta muy temprano, pues tiene que ordeñar a las 12 vacas que tiene en su establo. Esa es su principal actividad económica, cuenta que extrae un promedio de 25 litros de leche diarios, los que vende a una empresa muy conocida de productos lácteos en el país. Ahí ello obtiene un ingreso diario que le permite educar a sus hijos de la mejora manera posible. Ya por la tarde, cerrando su tienda de comestibles, ya que también se dedica a ese negocio, lleva a sus animales a pastar y alimentarse, de esa manera obtiene mayor cantidad de leche y aumenta su producción, ya que cuando más leche produzca su ganado, mejores ingresos obtendrá. Ahora su objetivo es construir un mejor establo que le permita criar mejor a sus animales.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere fallar a los miembros de su asociación, que son personas responsables.
Irma invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Irma, age 42, is a very hard-working woman.  She is married to Walter, and they have five children.  However, only three of the children live with them.  They live in their own house in Pampas.

She gets up very early at the first hours of the day.  She has to milk the 12 cows that she has in her stable.  This is her primary financial activity.  She says that she gets an average of 25 liters of milk a day.  She sells them to a company that is very well known for dairy products in the country.

This is where she gets a daily income, which allows her to educate her children in the best possible manner.  She also devotes herself to her grocery store business, which she closes in the afternoon.  Then she takes her animals to graze and feed.  This way she gets more milk and increases her production.  The more milk the cows produce, the better income she will get.  Her objective now is to build a better stable, which will allow her to better take care of her animals.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She does not want to fail the members of her association; they are responsible people.

Irma will use the requested money to buy balanced feed for her cows.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila is from Iraq. She is 40 years old, single, and lives with two family members.

Kamila is a seamstress, and she has been in this field since 1985. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally as suits, coats, and trousers for women and kids. She has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation, and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting $1,800 as a loan to purchase a sewing machine and buy fabrics. She is aiming to increase her production and gain more profit. This will offer her the opportunity to provide better living standards for her family.

For her protection, her photograph doesn't show her directly.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and buy fabrics

loans.name: Les Vainqueurs 2 Group

texts.en:
Bernadette, age 40, is married, with three children, age 13 to 24. All three children are attending school. She also provides and cares for her father.

Bernadette is representing the Les Vainqueurs 2 group. She sells clothing in a local market. She has had this business for 30 years! She has gained many valuable customers over the years. She will use the loan to buy more clothing to sell.  Her business strategy is to set her prices competitively against other sellers around her in the market. 

Bernadette has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo.  She has a good repayment record. She would like to become a large business owner, and she will continue to expand her business.  She hopes to be able to help her children study abroad one day.

loans.use: to pay for clothing.

loans.name: Gulana

texts.en:
Gulana is a 23-year-old woman, married, with two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is a farmer, raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has about five years of experience in this field, which makes her experienced and skilled. She gets financial support from the government of 50 AZN per month. 

Gulana usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan households and also make fresh punch.  Gulana's monthly income is 100 AZN.  Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for women.  That why her husband helps Gulana. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly sales.  For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1500 AZN, and this will be her third loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem is a resident living in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She is 37 years old and a mother of two daughters, both of whom are employed in a garment factory to help the family. Hem owns a grocery store where she offers breakfast and lunch to her customers, garment factory workers. From this business, she is able to make approximately USD 6.00 per day for her household expenses.

She would like to take out this loan to purchase construction supplies and pay for the construction fees to fix her house. Through this, Hem’s family will have a comfortable house that can protect her family from the bad impact of the weather. She is very happy and hopes that the fund will be given to her to renovate and fix her house. She is confident that she will be able to pay her loan back punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and pay for the construction fees to improve her house.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is 22-year-old single man who previously worked as a barber. A year ago, he opened up a convenience store, mainly selling detergents and disposable plastics for household use. Since he started, he has built a good reputation in his neighborhood due to his courtesy and competitive prices.

Abass is applying for a youth loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his shop's inventory. With this, he will be able to accommodate the increasing demands of his customers and further expand his business. Abass is optimistic about his business' future and is positive that with hard work, he can achieve his goals.

loans.use: To increase his inventory for his shop

loans.name: Musarart's Group

texts.en:
Musarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law’s scrap business.  With the loan investment she will buy scrap in bulk quantities that will allow her to fulfil her clients' orders on time and increase his profits.

Musarat is very good and professional in her business dealings.  She has been operating his business for many years.  She is hopeful that with the loan investment she will be able to increase his stock, sales and income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Musarat.

loans.use: to buy scrap for her scrap selling business.

loans.name: Deo-Gracias 1 Group

texts.en:
Clarisse, age 53, is a single mother with three children, ages 23 to 29 years old.  She is representing the Deo-Gracias 1 group.  

Clarisse owns a small bakery stand where she sells beignets and other pastries. She has been operating this business for over 20 years! She will use the loan to buy three large sacks of flour. Her business strategy is to sell her products outside of large stores. She has found that this is where many people are each day. 

Clarisse has received one previous loan from Kiva's partner, Hope Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to one day open a shop to sell her products in.

loans.use: to pay for three bags of flour.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон  46 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Чолпон в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается животноводством начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы с приплодом, 40 овец, 1 лошадь, продажа молока приносит около 3,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса посредством посадки картофеля на 0,5 га земли.
texts.en: Cholpon is 46 years old, married and has two children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2010, having started this business with a sum of 50,000 som.  Thanks to Cholpon's hard work, today her business contains two cows with offspring, forty sheep and one horse, and the sales of milk yield about 3,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Cholpon requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business by planting potatoes on 0.5 hectares of land.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Les Vainqueurs 1 Group

texts.en:
Jean Didier, age 52 years, is married and has 9 children, ages 5 to 24. All of his children are currently attending school. He also cares for his elderly father. 

Jean Didier is representing the Les Vainqueurs 1 group. He operates a grocery stand in a local market. He sells various food and household products that are in demand in his community. He has gained valuable experience over the 30 years he has had this business. He will use the loan to buy sugar, spaghetti, and cans of sardines for resale. His business strategy is to buy in bulk from his supplier, thus lowering the price per item. He will be able to buy in bulk and gain a better price because of the loan he will receive. 

Jean Didier has received 4 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to build a large boutique for his business one day.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, spaghetti, and cans of sardines for resale.

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Kubra is very active lady. She performs her household duties very well by staying at home.

Her husband does have a job, but his income is not enough to support the whole family. That’s why her three elder sons left their education and started different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially.

Kubra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son, who operates a grocery store in the market. With the loan investment, he will buy grocery items such as spices, sugar, and cooking oils in larger quantity. This will help him fulfill client orders on time and increase his sales and income.

He has been operating his business for many years.  Kubra is hopeful that his business will get more success after investing a loan.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her son's grocery store.

loans.name: Estrella De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Estrella de Luz lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora del grupo es Marlene de 64 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, chiverías, hielo y helado desde hace 6 años aproximadamente. Esta señora Jovial  quien tiene 8 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos le ayudan en el comercio y menciono que gracias a los créditos con las ganancias a logrado realizar mejoras en su hogar.
Actualmente ella desea invertir en la poner una venta de comida los fines de semana.
Las otras integrantes son Zeneyda de 33 años la cual tiene una comideria desde hace varios años y Heyling quien hace un año inicio una comideria.
texts.en:
The 'Estrella de Luz' group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people.  The group coordinator is 64-year-old Marlene who has been selling used clothing, snacks, ice and iced treats for approximately six years.  This cheerful lady has eight children, two of whom help her in her business.  She mentions that, thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to use her profits to make improvements to her home.  She would currently like to invest in setting up a food sales business which she will run on weekends.

The other members of this group are 33-year-old Zeneyda, who has run an eatery for several years, and Heyling, who set up an eatery one year ago.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat and perishables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Khadicha

texts.ru:
Хадиче 51 год, замужем. Хадича в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1994 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Хадичи в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, 1 лошадь, продажа молока приносит около 9,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хадича обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Хадича будет вкладывать в оплату обучения для дочери.
texts.en: Khadicha is 51 years old, married.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1994, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som.  Thanks to Khadicha's hard work, today her business contains three cows with offspring, ten sheep and one horse, and the sales of milk yield about 9,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Khadicha requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock for fattening up.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan paying for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fahmi

texts.en:
Fahmi is a 24-year-old, single man running a mini-market business. Over the years, he has grown his trade gradually from a convenience store to what it is now. Currently, he sells groceries, detergents, toiletries, soft drinks and tobacco products. He enjoys the loyalty of his customers who are satisfied with the quality of his products and reasonable pricing.

Fahmi is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to stock merchandise before Ramadan, the Islamic month of fasting. During that period, demand for foodstuffs rises substantially due to the habit of giving large feasts and community gatherings. For this, Fahmi has to be prepared to serve the needs of his crowded neighborhood and keep up to the competition from other traders.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of merchandise before Ramadan, the Islamic month of fasting.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Bailarines lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 3 años e invertirá en perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para cumplir con unos encargos que tiene.
Las otras integrantes son Jenny quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 8 años y Alex quien es transportistas desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The Los Bailarines ["The Dancers"] Group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising individuals one of whom is Maria, who have been selling cosmetics for three years and will invest in perfumes, creams, and cosmetics in order to fulfill the orders she has.

The other members are Jenny, who has been selling clothes and cosmetics for eight years, and Alex, who has been in the transportation business for three years.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan is a 32-year-old man, married, with two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds sheep and cattle and additionally sells milk products and meat. Sanan has more than five years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best way to look after cattle. 

Sanan usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in three to six months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yogurt, he sells to his neighbors.  Selling milk and meat brings in 150 AZN income per month.  Milk and yogurt are very popular products in Azerbaijan, as are beef and mutton.  People use meat in everyday national dishes like pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt. Milk products are considered very healthy, and they are also present in everyday life.   

There is only one income in Sanan's family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Sanan applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase six sheep, one cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy six sheep, one cow, and fodder

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
Williams tiene 27 años. Vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, quienes fallecieron hace dos años. Ahora vive junto a sus dos hermanos en la ciudad de Pampas.  
En honor a su madre todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, cuida de su tienda de comestibles que queda en su misma vivienda. Cuenta que la tienda era de su madre, quien después de su muerte le heredó. Por ello la cuida con mucha dedicación, a pesar de haber estudiado la carrera de ingeniería eléctrica en una universidad, él continúa en el negocio. “Trabajo en un proyecto de electrificación para el estado, ese trabajo es eventual depende de cuando tiempo dure el proyecto”, afirma. Ese es su principal problema, ya que en esa temporada cierra la tienda y sólo abre en sus tiempos libres. En la actualidad desea incrementar algunos productos alimenticios que le solicitaron sus clientes.

Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y en todo este tiempo pudo solventar algunas necesidades de su negocio, gracias al apoyo financiero obtenido. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere fallar a los miembros de su asociación, que son personas responsables. 
Williams invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Williams is 27 years old. He lives in the house that he inherited from his parents, who died two years ago. He now lives with his two brothers in the city of Pampas.

In honor of his mother, starting very early every day, he takes care of her grocery store, which is located in the house. He says that the store was his mother's and he inherited it after she died. For this reason he takes care of it with great dedication. In spite of having studied for an electrical engineering career at a university, he continues with the business. "I work on an electrification project for the state, that job is temporary work depending on how long the project lasts," he says. That is his main problem, since during that time he closes the store and only opens during his free time. Currently he wants to add some food products that his customers asked him for. 

This is his third loan with MFP, and during this time he has been able to cover some of the needs of his business, thanks to the financial support obtained. Because of this, he promises to be punctual with his repayments, since he does not want to fail the members of his association, who are responsible people.

Williams will use the money requested to purchase staple products for his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase staple products to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Martha Yaqueline

texts.es:
En el sector del Colegio Uruguay en la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Buenos Amigos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos 14 y 6 años de edad y el último de dos meses, el mayor estudia en colegio y el siguiente en escuela. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta  para con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar también a su esposo con la dura carga que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil y también le envían desde los Estados Unidos ya que tiene familiares en este país. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, carteras, bisutería y otras cosas que ella vende. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gusta por la rapidez con que salió el crédito.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of Banco Comunal Buenos Amigos meet every fifteen days in the sector of Colegio Uruguay in the beautiful and friendly city of Portoviejo, also known as "The City of the Royal Tamarinds".

Martha, 32, lives in this area. She is married and has three children -- a two-month-old baby, a six-year-old, and a fourteen-year-old.  The older children are currently in school.  Her husband is privately employed.

So that she can make some of her own income to be able to help her husband meet the household expenses, our friend sells clothing of all types as well as jewelry.  She works door-to-door and also sells her merchandise out of her home, where she has a small shop. She works every day, extending credit to her customers and collecting every fifteen days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise, and some of her relatives also send her products from the United States to sell.  She has had this business for three years, and things are going very well.

This loan is to buy clothes, purses, jewelry and other items that she sells.  This is her first loan with the communal bank.  She is pleased with how quickly she is able to get a loan through the bank.  Her dream is to be able to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, purses, jewelry and other items for resale.

loans.name: Fedor

texts.ru:
На протяжении 3-х лет сельский фермер Федор занимается выращиванием сладкого перца, малины и картофеля.
По хозяйству ему помогают  двое детей.  Старшему сыну 19 лет, он учится в университете на музыканта.  Младший  сын   учится  в школе, ему 15 лет.
Ранее Федор занимался выращиванием петрушки и укропа в теплицах.
Для повышения урожая было принято решение  приобрести агро волокно, пленку и  систему капельного полива.
На будущее в планах Федора - поставить еще две теплицы, а также увеличить площади под посадку  малины и чеснока.
texts.en:
Fedor is a village farmer who has been cultivating sweet peppers, raspberries and potatoes for the last three years. His children help him in this business. His oldest son is nineteen years old and he is studying to be a musician at the university. His younger son goes to school, he is fifteen years old.

Earlier Fedor used to grow parsley and dill in the greenhouse. To increase the yield it was decided to purchase agro fiber, film and drip irrigation. In the future Fedor plans to install two greenhouses as well as to increase the area for planting raspberries and garlic.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment.

loans.name: Deo-Gracias 2 Group

texts.en:
Clarisse is 44 years old, married, with six children, ages 5 to 26 years old. She has three children attending school. She also cares for her father. 

Clarisse is representing the Deo-Gracias 2 group. She sells children's clothing and has been operating this business for five years. She will use the loan to buy children's clothing and sandals to restock her supply. Her business strategy is to keep a large variety and quantity of clothes at her stand. She is also willing to negotiate with clients and find the best price. 

Clarisse has received one previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She did well with her first loan. She would like to open up a grocery stand one day. She is saving and planning for this transition.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and sandals to restock her supply.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 27-year-old single man who has run an Internet café with his father for more than eight years now. He offers Internet access and a digital gaming network to his customers, who are mostly teenagers. Throughout the years, he succeeded in building a respectful reputation for his place, whilst maintaining quality service and competitive prices.

Kassem is always keen on developing and expanding his business.  He has already saved some money, and he is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to complete what he needs. He will use the loan to pave the entrance to his shop and to buy new computers for $550 each.

loans.use: to buy new computers for his Internet cafe and pave the entrance.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Omania has been active in farming at his rural home in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and one child, aged 3 years. His eight years in farming has enabled him meet his family's basic needs. 

His farm currently produces milk, vegetables, maize, and beans, which he sells to the local market. He manages his farm with the help of two farmhands. He runs a small agro-vet shop, mainly serving local dairy farmers, and he also makes building bricks, which he sells to residents doing construction.

Omania has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo.  The money will help him construct a modern dairy unit and buy a power generator to help pump water for his animals and the farm in general. He is focusing on booting up his agro-vet business and buying more land in the future.

He notes that pests, drought, and hailstones are the occasional major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a power generator and buiild a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has worked as a tailor from home for more than 20 years, mainly in fixing and patching clothing. Zeinab’s customers are quite satisfied with her fine-finishing and good prices.

To maintain her quality service, Zeinab needs to buy a new sewing machine, since her current one is not working right. For this purpose, she is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua.  With the new machine, Zeinab will be able to carry on her work without difficulty and retain her customers. She will even increase her production rate and have the capacity to serve more clients.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Joseline Nohemi

texts.es:
Joseline tiene 20 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella lleva dos años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de antojitos como: enredos, tostadas, enchiladas, pastelitos, tacos, etc. Esta actividad la aprendió de una hermana, que tenia un negocio similar en donde Joseline le ayudo durante tres años y poco a poco fue adquiriendo el equipo para instalar su propio negocio. Los materiales para elaborar los antojitos los compra en dos ciudades del oriente del país.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir una galera en su negocio para que sus clientes degusten sus alimentos y se protejan del sol y del agua. Lo que ella desea es mejorar las instalaciones de su local, para que lleguen más clientes y sus ingresos sean mejores. Con el objetivo de adquirir todo lo necesario para su hijo, ya que todos los gastos corren por su propia cuenta.
texts.en:
Joseline is 20 years old and has a son.  For the past two years she has been making and selling snacks such as enredos, tostadas, enchiladas, pastelitos, tacos and other items.  She learned these skills when she was helping her sister, who has a similar business.  She did this for three years and little by little acquired the capital to go into business for herself.  She buys her ingredients from two cities in the eastern part of the country.

She is seeking this loan so that she can build a covered patio so that her customers can enjoy their meals and be protected from the sun and rain.  She wants to make this improvement to her location so that she can attract more customers and increase her income.  Her underlying goal is to be able to provide her son with everything he needs, since she is paying for all of his expenses on her own.

loans.use: to build a covered patio so that her customers can enjoy their meals and be protected from the sun and rain.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 32-year-old married woman who is caring for three kids.

Last time, she took a loan to help her husband in his store.  But now Majeda has started selling clothes at home, mainly for ladies.  In the photo, Majeda is showing a sample of what she has for sale. 

Majeda wants to bring in more clothes in different styles from the free trade zone and wholesale market.  To pay for that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her new business.

loans.name: Rivas Quinto

texts.es: Alexy vive en el Fortín, a sus 37 años tiene una venta de ropa deportiva. Es madre soltera de niños de 8 y 18 años de edad. Empezó este negocio hace 4 años atrás cuando decidió vender camisetas con logotipos de equipos de futbol de mayor reconocimiento a las afuera de los estadios sobre todo en los campeonatos nacionales. En la actualidad sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio los fines de semana y cuando hay partidos importantes. Ofrece variedad ya que hay para niños y grandes, también viseras, pañuelos, manoplas etc. su mayor preocupación es la delincuencia ya que en las multitudes es cuando aprovechan para robar. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería por mayor para vender por unidad. Desea progresar mas a futuro para brindarles a sus hijos todo el apoyo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Alexy lives in Fortín and at 37 years old she sells sports apparel. She is a single mother of children who are 8 and 18 years old. She began this business four years ago when she decided to sell shirts with the logos of well-recognized soccer teams outside of the stadiums, overall of the national soccer championships. Currently her children help her in the business on the weekends and when there are important games. 

She offers a variety that are for children and larger, also visors, handkerchiefs and gloves, etc. Her largest worry is the delinquency since in the crowds is when they take the opportunity to rob. With this loan she will buy wholesale merchandise to sell individually. She hopes to progress more in the future to bring her children all of the help that they need.

loans.use: to purchase sports clothes for resale

loans.name: José Maximino

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco años. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a trabajar con cerdos, él siempre a tenido un cerdo; pero hoy en día, él se esta dedicando específicamente a la crianza de varios cerdos.

Antes él se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero poco a poco a trabajado solo con cerdos y en la construcción. Don José compra el concentrado y los desparacitantes de sus cerdos en una comunidad, para llegar ahí, tiene que buscar un vehículo que le haga los viajes hasta la comunidad ya que no tiene como desplazarse y la ciudad le queda a 5 minutos en vehículo. 

El  préstamo que esta solicitando sera utilizado para la compra de concentrado para los cerdos y para la compra de insumos agrícolas, ya que él espera seguir cosechando sus propios cultivos. Con la compra de los insumos agrícolas y  del concentrado sus animales estarán mas cuidados y ademas tendrá mejor alimentación para luego su comercialización. Con los insumos agrícolas su necesidad que satisface es que logra tener sus propios granos básicos.
Con la inversión, se logra que él tenga un trabajo estable, ya que se dedicara a su granja de cerdos y también él lograra tener mas insumos para la cosecha que esta realizando, darle un buen mantenimiento.
 
Su propósito es ser un gran comerciante de cerdos en la zona; también buscar la forma de que su hija continué estudiando, ya que es ella la que le gusta estudiar y seguir creciendo económicamente con otro negocio del ganado.
texts.en:
José, 41, is married and has five children.  He’s worked with pigs for the last 8 years.  He’s always had a pig and today he’s specifically working raising several pigs.

He used to work in agriculture but gradually started working just with pigs and in construction.  José buys feed concentrate and deparasitizers for his pigs in a community that in order to reach he has to find a vehicle that makes trips to that community since he has no way of transporting himself and the city is five minutes away by car.

The loan he’s requesting will be used to buy feed concentrate for the pigs and to buy farm supplies since he hopes to continue to grow his own crops.  
With the purchase of farm supplies and animal feed they will be better cared for and they will be better fed for subsequent sale.  With respect to the farm supplies the need he’ll meet is to have his own basic grains.

With this investment he will have stable work since he will work in his pig farm and also will have more supplies to provide care for the crops he’s growing.  His goal is to be a great pig merchant in the zone and also to find a way for his daughter to continue in school since she likes to study and to continue growing economically with another livestock business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Mi Niño Jesus De Iv Programa Group

texts.es:
La señora Giuliana tiene 34 años de edad y es integrante del grupo “Mi niño Jesús de IV Programa” conformado por 07 personas desde hace más de un año, todos ellos muy trabajadores y emprendedores. La señora Giuliana es madre de 03 niños, todos ellos menores de edad y en etapa escolar. Ella dedica su tiempo diario a atender y administrar su pequeña librería, con los ingresos por las ventas puede darles educación a sus 03 hijos; cabe mencionar, que ella es el único sostén de su hogar.  El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares para poder ampliar su negocio.
La señora Giuliana es la cuarta de la izquierda, viste casaca roja y polo negro.
texts.en:
Giuliana, who is 34 years old, is one of the members of the group "Mi Niño Jesus de IV Programa". The group was formed over a year ago and has 7 members who work and fight day after day  to improve the financial situation in their homes. 

An example of this is that Giuliana, who has three children that are minors, works daily to tend the small bookstore in her house. With the earnings from the sales she can provide an education to her three children. It should be mentioned that she is the only person who sustains her home economically. 

She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of school supplies to make her business bigger. 

Sra. Giuliana is on the 4th from the left, in a red jacket and black shirt.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her library

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 30 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Nazca; él es una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, con un gran deseo de superación, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres, quienes gracias a su esfuerzo lo apoyaron para que culminara sus estudios profesionales de Derecho; en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Puré con Bisteck para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y por iniciativa propia, desde hace varios años Carlos puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, él realiza sus ventas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de su ciudad; Carlos dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, él cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que sus clientes los recomiendan por sus  productos y buena atención.  
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: casacas, pantalones, chompas, buzos, entre otras prendas de vestir de acuerdo a la estación; de esta manera Carlos podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales espera poder ahorrar lo suficiente para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda lograr tener sus tienda comercial de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Carlos, 30, is single living with his parents and siblings in the city of Nazca.  He’s a very cheerful, enthusiastic, hardworking person who very much wants to improve himself and who puts all his efforts into getting ahead and supporting his parents who thanks to their efforts supported him so that he could finish his professional Law studies.  In his free time he enjoys relaxing while listening to music and sometimes cooks a delicious “Puré con Bisteck” to share with his family.

With much effort, enthusiasm and initiative of his own, Carlos set up a small clothing sales business several years ago.  He sells in an ambulatory fashion in his city’s market.  He spends about 12 hours daily in his business and he believes that it runs well because his customers recommend him for his products and good service.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support he’s gotten he will be able to buy merchandise like jackets, pants, sweaters, sweatshirts, among other articles of seasonal clothing.  In this way, Carlos will be able to increase his sales and income hoping to be able to save enough so that in a not too distant future he can have a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 63 años y está casada con Gilberto un productor de café y fue él quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para que ella también se dedicara a esta actividad. Ellos tienen 3 hijos ya casados pero que también les ayudan a trabajar en sus parcelas en la época de cosecha, pues hay muchas actividades por hacer. Ella y su esposo tienen 6,000 plantas de café y quieren tener para la próxima cosecha un total de 7,000. Las plantas nuevas que siembren les estarán dando frutos en un lapso de 3 años. Para poder alcanzar su meta necesitan de un crédito ya que aparte de invertir en las plantas nuevas también será necesario comprar fertilizantes para que crezcan fuertes y den un café de calidad. Ellos entregan su cosecha a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” que se encarga de procesarlo y exportarlo. Con la ayuda del crédito ellos podrán aumentar su producción y sus ingresos, ya que en la zona donde viven el café es el único medio de trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 63 years old, and is married to Gilberto, who is a coffee grower.  It was he who taught her everything necessary so that she could also do this type of work. She has three children who are already married, but they also help her and her husband in their fields during the harvest season, since there are many things that need to be done.  They have 6,000 coffee plants and hope to have 7,000 for the next harvest.  The new plants that they plant will bear fruit after three years.  In order to achieve their goals they will need a loan, since apart from investing in new plants, they will also have to buy fertilizer so that they can grow strong and healthy plants that will produce high quality coffee beans.

They deliver their coffee to “Unión Regional de Huatusco”, which is in charge of processing and exporting the beans.  With this loan they will be able to increase their production and their income, since in the area where they live, growing coffee is the only way to make a living.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. Four years ago, she started stocking stationery at her house and selling it to her friends and neighbors. This business allowed her to contribute to her household expenses and assist her husband in providing a respectable living for their children.

Asma is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to buy more stationery, such as paper, copybooks, office supplies, and pens. The more she sells, the more she can save money from her revenues to fulfill her future business plan.  Asma has been accumulating savings to open up her own stationery store, separate from home.

loans.use: to buy more stationery such as paper, copybooks, office supplies and pens

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a resident of Kitale in western Kenya.  She has been in farming for 10 years, producing and selling maize, milk, and vegetables to the local market. She is married, with three children, aged between 1 and 12 years. She also runs a hotel in the local market.

Rael has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic she will have enough milk both for her family and to sell for additional income to educate her children.

Rael says that animal diseases and price fluctuations in the local markets remain the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas E Independientes Group

texts.es:
El padre de Susana  se dedica a la venta de mayólicas y cerámicos. Tiene 02 tiendas en una zona muy comercial donde los productos que vende son muy requeridos. Susana dirige una de las tiendas donde realiza las ventas  diarias y la atención a los clientes, ya son cerca de 08 años que su padre empezó el negocio antes solo tenían 01 tienda muy pequeña pero gracias a su trabajo arduo y mucho sacrificio  ahora tienen 02 tiendas, este trabajo es la principal fuente de ingreso para  su familia. Susana quiere abrir su propia tienda, los ingresos que percibe por su trabajo los ahorra para este fin; por otro lado, ella también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza con lo cual puede cubrir sus necesidades básicas. El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar más productos de belleza ya que la demanda de dichos productos ha aumentado; además esto le ayudará para cumplir su meta de abrir su propia tienda de mayólicas y cerámicos. La alcancía a la cual pertenece es “ MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES”  está conformada por 08 socias. 
*Susana aparece con chompa color fucsia y cartera blanca.
*En la parte inferior central se encuentran al lado izquierdo la Sra. lizzette y al lado derecho el Sr. Hernan.
texts.en:
Susana’s father sells tiles and ceramics.  He has two stores in a commercial area where these products are in great demand.
