Susana manages one of these stores and is able to generate daily sales and attend to the customers.  It has been nearly eight years since her father started this business.  Prior to that they only had one very small store, but thanks to their hard work and many sacrifices, they now have two stores.  This business is the main source of income for their family.  

Susana wants to open her own store.  The income she has earned from working up to now has been saved up specifically for this purpose.  She also sells beauty products in order to earn additional income to cover a few basic necessities.  The loan she is receiving will be very useful for buying products that her customers have requested.  Her co-workers are her most frequent buyers.  She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Decidadas e Independientes” (Decisive and Independent Women), which consists of eight members.  

*Susana is the woman wearing a fuchsia-colored sweater and carrying a white purse.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 57-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 15 to 32 years old. He describes himself as an organized and focused man. He operates a motorcycle and he provides transportation, rental houses accomodation and sells home products and milk. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs a staff member. His business is located within a highly populated area and his primary customers are businesspeople and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of home products. He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern. His business goal is to own many rental houses within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will purchase land in his hometown.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She began farming over ten years ago. The only challenge she faces in this regard is the seasonal weather. Loice also owns a retail shop from where she sells cereals, flour and paraffin.

Loice learned of Milango from her friends. She is now applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to buy beans, maize flour, paraffin, etc. for her shop. She will save the extra income to educate her children. Her ambition is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase beans, maize flour, paraffin etc.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo est un jeune homme marié de 30 ans. Exerçant dans le domaine de la maintenance informatique, il effectue également de façon secondaire la vente de téléphone et  en fait également la réparation. Il est confronté au problème de manque d’argent ce qui ralentit de manière significative son activité. Kodjo opère son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce montant dans le but de s’approvisionner en téléphones. Il espère avec ce crédit faire beaucoup de profit et ainsi se réaliser sur le plan professionnel. Il souhaite avoir à l’avenir une grande boutique et un centre de formation.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a young, married man aged 30. He works in IT maintenance, and also has an additional job selling and repairing telephones. He has faced the problem of a lack of money, which has significantly slowed down his business. 

Kodjo is on his second loan from WAGES, and has requested this money to buy supplies of telephones. He hopes to use this loan to make much more profit, and therefore realize his professional plans. In the future, he would like to have a large store and a training center.

loans.use: To buy telephones.

loans.name: Sedotodé Grâce

texts.fr: Sedotodé Grâce est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des mèches et des habits depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du marché du Bénin et sa clientèle est composée des habitants quartier et de ses environs. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de satisfaire ses clients et d'accroitre son revenu. Le gain dégagé lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation des enfants et d'avoir accès à l'électricité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de mèches.
texts.en:
Sedotodé Grâce is a married mother of four children, all of whom are at school. She specializes in selling hair extensions and clothing, and has done so for several years. She gets her supplies from Benin market, and her customers all live in the neighborhood and the surrounding areas. 

Sedotodé Grâce has prior experience with loans, and has requested financing from Finadev to satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her income. Her profits will allow her to contribute to her children’s education, as well as to have access to electricity. She plans to open a hair extension store.

loans.use: To buy five dozen hair extensions and three packs of weaves.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 43 años,  vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus 4 hijos, lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años decidió separarse de su pareja, desde entonces ella ha sido madre y padres para sus hijos, Maritza siempre ha sido una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos, no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermería; en sus ratos lubres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Cabrito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace 2 años Maritza puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella realiza sus ventas en su hogar, dedica un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y puede atender un promedio de 15 clientes, Maritza cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que sus clientes la recomiendan por sus buenos productos y su buena atención.
Martiza se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, gaseosas, entre otros artículos, así también utilizará la ayuda para comprar andamios y mostradores para exhibir sus productos; de esta manera Maritza tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, incrementando sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder utilizarlos para realizar la construcción de su vivienda con materiales adecuados, ya que actualmente su vivienda está construida de quincha y barro, y ella desea poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza, 43, lives in the city of Ica in Santiago District with her four children.  Sadly, for various circumstances she decided to separate from her spouse several years ago and since then she’s been both mother and father for her children.  Maritza has always been a very enthusiastic, hardworking woman.  She puts all her efforts into moving her family ahead.  Sadly, due to the need to work and cover her expenses, she was unable to study a professional career but would have liked to have studied Nursing.  In her free time she enjoys dancing and sometimes cooks a delicious “Seco de Cabrito” to share with her family.

Through her own initiative and thanks to support from her family Maritza started a small, home-based grocery store two years ago.  She spends about 12 hours daily at work and can take care of up to 15 customers.  Maritza believes that her business is doing well thanks to her customers recommending her for her good products and service.

Maritza is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they give her she’ll be able to buy merchandise for her store like rice, sugar, milk, oil, soft-drinks, among other items and she will also use the help to buy shelving and display cases to display her products.  In this way Maritza will have her store better equipped and stocked thus increasing her sales and income with which in the not too distant future she hopes to build her house with adequate materials since her current house is built out of reeds and mud and she wants to give greater security and wellbeing to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, shelving and display cases.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is married, with three children, aged between 5 and 10; all three children attend school.  He has been a maize farmer for two years, and his wife is a maize farmer, too. He would like to get this loan to buy and harvest seeds  and to pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate his house and pay his children's school fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product; generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy and harvest seeds and hire support labor.

loans.name: Maoutondji Léonce's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Maoutondji Léonce est mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des vêtements, des bijoux, des sacs et des chaussures depuis quelques années. Maoutondji Léonce fait ses approvisionnements dans la sous région. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et obtenu son micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer son stock et de participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Maoutondji Léonce is 38 years of age, married, and has one child who is at school. She has a store where she sells clothing, jewelry, bags and shoes, and has done so for several years. She gets her supplies in the sub-region. 

To increase her capital and successfully meet customer demand, Maoutondji Léonce has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. This will allow her to increase her stock, as well as to help with the family expenses.

loans.use: To buy two dozen sets of lingerie, one dozen shoes and eight pieces of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, shelving and a counter.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Don Enrique sigue laborando en servicios de seguridad, contando con el apoyo de su esposa, ya que también sigue vendiendo frutas, ayudándose para los gastos del hogar. Ya que ambos como objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Con este préstamo seguirá dando mejor condición de aseo personal  a su familia, ya que cerrara todo el baño de concreto y hará sus respectivas divisiones, ya que anteriormente al hacer el muro afecto esta mejora, lo que comprara materiales de construcción para seguir levantado las paredes y terminar ya que es de gran relevancia en su hogar.
texts.en:
Enrique continues working providing security services and having his wife’s support since she continues selling fruit helping each other to cover household expenses since they both share the objective of improving their living conditions.

With this loan he will continue to improve his family’s hygiene situation since he will enclose the entire bathroom with concrete and will make the respective divisions since erecting the previous wall affected this improvement.  He will buy building materials and supplies to continue erecting walls and to finish since this is of great relevance for his home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.ru:
Более 12 – ти лет назад Валерий стал сельским фермером.   Выращивает  помидоры, огурцы, картофель и клубнику на земельной площади 75 соток. По хозяйству ему помогают супруга и двое его детей. Старшей  девочке 17 лет, она учится в институте.  Младшему сыну 14 лет, он учится в школе.
Для облегчения труда и обработки земельного участка решили приобрести мотоблок и почвофрезу.
В хозяйственных планах Валерия - расширить площадь посадки клубники с 6 до 20 соток, высадить саженцы малины на 10 сотках.
Семейные планы- достроить дом, помочь детям получить хорошее образование,  купить новую машину.
texts.en:
Valeriy became a village farmer more than twelve years ago. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes and strawberries on 75 acres area of land. His spouse and two children help him in this business. His older daughter is seventeen years old and she goes to college. His younger son is fourteen years old and he goes to school.

To facilitate his work and processing of his land Valeriy and his family decided to purchase a walk-behind tractor and tillers. Valeriy's business plans are to expand the area for the ​​planting of strawberries from six to twenty acres and to plant the seedlings of raspberries on ten acres. His plans for the family are to finish building the house, help his children get a good education and to buy a new car.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical farming equipment.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima, 23, is a housewife and a mother for three kids.

Rima has a small handmade embroidery business making pillows and table covers, beside other fabric pieces for decoration.

She has applied for this youth loan to buy more fabric and colorful threads to expand and increase the business she has.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and colorful threads.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is 32 years old and lives in Kenya. She is married, and the couple has four children living at home, all of whom attend school. Together they cover the various household expenses.

For the last three years Mbodze has operated a kiosk from which she sells basic goods to her neighbors. Thanks to the income this activity generates, she is able to contribute to meeting the family's expenses.

In order to meet her growing customer demands, Mbodze is seeking a 30,000 KES loan with Yehu. She will use it to buy more stock for her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her kiosk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años, es una mujer amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Se casó hace 18 años con Humberto, de 41 años, y fruto de su amor tienen cuatro hijos que aún dependen de ellos; sus edades son 18, 15, 12 y 7 años. Vive en la casa que pudo construir junto a su esposo gracias al esfuerzo que ponen cada uno en su trabajo.

Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes. Todos los días, desde muy temprano, abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a todos sus clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento en busca de algún producto con la seguridad que ahí encontrarán lo que necesitan. Su bodega es la más surtida de su barrio y sus clientes no dudan en comprarle también por la calidad en las marcas que ofrece y el trato tan cordial. Recuerda que cuando se inició en este negocio no tenía muchos productos que ofrecer por lo que no lograba tener buenas ventas durante el día, eso la desanimaba a menudo, sin embargo buscó la solución, completó un pequeño capital y poco a poco fue implementando su pequeña tienda. Ahora le va muy bien en sus ventas y desde entonces hasta la actualidad han transcurrido 15 años de mucho trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es intercambiar con sus clientes instantes de felicidad, conversar con ellos y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para atender su bodega, aún cuando se siente cansada, sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, espera que más adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que desde que supo de esta microfinanciera, hace más de 5 años tiene un apoyo financiero. Por eso se compromete, una vez más, en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en sus anteriores créditos. Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará mayor cantidad de productos con los que implementará su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old.  She is a kind, responsible, and hardworking woman.  She married 41-year-old Humberto 18 years ago and together they have four children who are still their dependents.  Their ages are 18, 15, 12, and 7.  She lives in the home she was able to build with her husband thanks to the effort they each put into their work.

She has a business selling groceries.  Every day, starting very early, she opens her store doors to serve all the customers who come to her business looking for products, knowing that they will find what they need.  Her store is the best stocked in the neighborhood and, in addition to that, her customers do not hesitate to buy from her because of the quality brands she offers and her wonderful customer service.  She remembers that when she started this business she did not have many products to offer and so she was not able to make good sales during the day.  This often discouraged her, but she nevertheless sought a solution; she saved up a small amount of capital and, little by little, she stocked her small store.  Now her sales are very good and 15 years of hard work have passed since then.  What she likes most about her work is sharing happy moments with her customers, talking with them, and seeing them start their days with a smile.  She finds that the hardest part is having to get up early to work in her store, but even when she feels tired, she knows that it is her job and she has to do it.  She hopes that her business will grow in the future and make her better income.

This is her 14th loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that since she discovered this microfinancier five years ago she has had financial support.  That is why she promises, once again, to make her payments on time, as she has with her previous loans.  She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank, as all of its members are very responsible and supportive. 

She will use the requested 2,000 nuevos soles to buy a greater variety of products with which she will stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, etc. to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Katya Carolina

texts.es:
La Srta. Katya Carolina de 21 años de edad soltera, ella vive con su mama dado a que su papa falleció hace pocos meses, por lo cual ella ha asumido el rol de cabeza de familia. 
Katya cuenta con una antigüedad de 3 años en su empleo, es responsable por ello ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, en ocasiones su mama la apoya vendiendo ropa de segunda mano pero el empleo de Katya es el principal ingreso de la familia.
Ante esta situación ella se hace responsable de cuidar a su mama y procurar que nada les falte. Solicita de nuestra ayuda para empezar a construir una barda frente a su casa además de pagar mano de obra. Con esto podrá brindar una mejor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Katya Carolina, 21, is single living with her mother because her father died a few months ago and she’s taken on the role of head of family.

Katya has three years’ experience in her job.  She’s responsible which is why she’s been able to move her family forward.  Sometimes her mother helps her selling second-hand clothes but Katya’s job is the family’s main source of income.

In face of this situation, she assumes the responsibility of caring for her mother and seeing that they lack nothing.  She’s asking our help to start building a wall in front of her house and also to pay labor costs for the project.  With this she will offer better security for her family.

loans.use: to build a front wall.

loans.name: Gualaceñitas  (Gualeceo) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Gualaceñitas está formado por 14 socias quienes viven en el cantón Gualaceo, cantón que es conocido como el Jardín del Azuay por sus tierras aptas para la agricultura y su clima templado, también se dedican a la cría de animales y comercio. Su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora como nuestras socias, sus hábiles manos elaboran el más fino calzado y otras artesanías, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mariana de Jesús, tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 11 hijos, 2 de sus hijos son casados, 4 trabajan y estudian a distancia, 1 estudia en el colegio y 4 trabajan y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Mariana de Jesús se dedica a la agricultura, siembra y vende hortalizas y también cría cerdos y pollos, también se dedica el bordado hace 24 años y esta actividad la aprendió trabajando, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario ya que labora desde su casa.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la  compra cerdos.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Las Gualaceñitas communal bank is made up of 14 members who live in the canton of Gualaceo. This canton is known as the garden of Azuay because of its suitable land and template climate. They also raise animals and have commerce there. Its people are kind, polite and hardworking, like our members. Their able hands make the finest shoes and other artisanal crafts. They still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Mariana de Jesús. She is  53, married and the mother of 11 children. Two of her children are married, four work and study elsewhere, 1 is in high school and 4 work and help out financially.  Her husband is a farmer, and they own the house they live in.

Mariana de Jesús is a farmer. She grows and sells vegetables. She also raises pigs and chickens and embroiders. She has embroidered for 24 years and learned the activity on the job. She works Mondays through Fridays with no set schedule, because she works at home. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and will invest the new loan in buying pigs. 
 
Her dream is for her children to get ahead and have good jobs.

The two small photos are of three members who weren't able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Camino Al Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Camino al Progreso está formado por 12 socias, quienes viven en diferentes sectores de la parroquia Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como la Merced de Turi, se encuentra al sureste de la ciudad, es muy visitada ya que desde allí se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, también es conocida como el Balcón Cuencano. Su gente al igual que nuestras socias son personas amables, gentiles, se dedican a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer en diferentes plazas de trabajo, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres les han inculcado.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Eloisa, tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es pintor de profesión, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña María Eloisa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como vive en el campo trabaja en la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y verduras las mismas que son para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta, también cría y vende cerdos y pollos, estas actividades las realiza hace varios años.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando alimento para animales y cerdos.
 
Sus metas son crecer en la cría de cerdos y  tener un granja.
texts.en:
The “El Camino al Progreso” (The Road to Progress) communal bank has 12 members who live in different parts of Turi Parish in Cuenca.  This parish is known as “La Merced de Turi” and is located in the southeast of the city.  It is very popular because a great part of the city of Cuenca can be observed from there.  It’s also knows as “El Balcón Cuencano” [The Cuenca Balcony].  Its residents, like our members, are nice, kind people who raise animals, farm and are merchants.  Many go out daily to work in various jobs in the city.  They preserve the culture and traditions their parents have instilled in them.

One of the members of this group is María Eloisa, 34.  She’s married and has had three children who are 14, 11 and 3 years of age.  Her oldest daughter attends secondary school and her second daughter the little local elementary school.  Her husband’s a painter by profession and the house they live in is theirs.

María Eloisa does her household chores but since they live in the countryside she works in agriculture.  She plants vegetables and greens both for home consumption and to sell; she also raises pigs and chickens, activities she’s been doing for several years.

This is the second loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she will use it to buy animal and pig feed.  Her goals are to grow as a pig farmer and to own a farm.

loans.use: to buy animal and pig feed.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ofelia de 44 años de edad es casada y con una hija, se dedica junto con su esposo a la venta de tacos y gorditas desde hace 5 años. Atreves de esto ha podido sacar adelante a su hija, además de darle un claro ejemplo de que con trabajo y esfuerzo todo es posible. 
Anteriormente también contaba con una tienda de abarrotes la cual tuvo que cerrar ya que amplio un cuarto en planta baja para hacer más grande el negocio el cual restaurara en unos meses, ahora ella solicita de nuestra ayuda para pagar la compostura de su automóvil, el cual utiliza los siete días de la semana para trasladarse a vender a otro punto de la ciudad y a realizar las compras de mercancía, por el momento ella tiene que trasladarse en carros de sitio y esto le ha generado gastos innecesarios pero tiene que hacerlos para seguir vendiendo y surtir  su negocio.
Ofelia agradecerá la ayuda brindada. Esperando que el crédito le ayude a mejorar su economía cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Ofelia, who is 44 years old, is married and has one daughter, has made a living for the past five years, together with her husband, on the sale of tacos and gorditas.   Through this she has been able to help her daughter to get ahead as well as give her a clear example of everything that is possible with work and effort.  Previously, she could also count on a grocery store which she had to close to expand a room on the ground floor to make the business larger and which will be restored in a few months.

Now, she is applying for our help to pay for the repair of her automobile, which she uses seven days a week to go to sell elsewhere in the city and to conduct the purchase of merchandise.  For the time being she has to go in taxis and this has created unnecessary expenses for her but she has to do it in order to keep selling and stocking her business.  Ofelia is grateful for the assistance provided to her.  She hopes that the loan with help her to increasingly improve her finances.

loans.use: to repair her automobile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mechanical farming equipment.

loans.name: La Florida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Florida está formado por 6 socias y 2 socios quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una geografía accidentada, cuenta con diferentes lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su gente al igual que todas nuestras socias aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables, gentiles y muy trabajadoras. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Lastenia, tiene 44 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 19, 18, 15 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad, su tercer hijo en el colegio y su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios a una empresa privada, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña María Lastenia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero hace 6 meses también se dedica a la venta de ropa, esta actividad la realiza recorriendo la ciudad y también vende a sus amigos y familiares.
 
Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería. 

Su sueño es tener un local o una boutique para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The La Florida communal bank is comprised of six women and two men who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known as the Santa Ana of the Four Rivers.   In December 1999 it was named a Cultural World Heritage Site.  Cuenca has a varied geography, which provides beautiful landscapes to enjoy nature.  Its people, like all of our members, still maintain the culture and traditions of their pueblos.  They are kind, gracious, and very hard-working. 

María Lastenia, age 44, is one of the members of this group.  She is married, and they have four children, ages 19, 18, 15, and 10.  Her first daughter is married and lives independently.  Her second child attends the university.  Her third child goes to high school, and her last child goes to a city school.  Her husband is a driver for a private company.  The house they live in belongs to them.

María Lastenia devotes herself to the household chores.  She has also been selling clothes for six months.  She does this by going from place to place in the city, and she also sells to her friends and family members.

This is her third loan with her communal bank.  She will use it to buy clothes to stock her merchandise.

Her dream is to have a place or a boutique where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана использовала предыдущий кредит для увеличения торгового оборота, благодаря чему она получила дополнительную прибыль и смогла лучше позаботиться о своей семье.

В этот раз Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 20,000 гривен для закупки летнего товара - женских легких платьев, сарафанов, футболок, пр. Светлана прекрасно разбирается в женской одежде и всегда замечательно обслуживает своих клиентов. Это является залогом успеха ее бизнеса. Светлана мечтает открыть небольшой собственный магазин по продаже женской одежды.

Светлана занимается спортом и поддерживает прекрасную физическую форму. Это помогает ей как в личной жизни, так и в бизнесе.
texts.en:
Svetlana used her prior loan to increase her product inventory, thanks to which she earned extra profits and was able to take better care of her family.

This time Svetlana is asking for a loan of 20,000 Hryvnia to purchase summer products - light women's dresses, sleeveless dresses, tshirts, etc.  Svetlana is well versed in women's clothing and always serves her customers remarkably.  This is the key to the success of her business.  Svetlana dreams of opening a small store of her own that sells women's clothing.  

Svetlana exercises and is in excellent physical shape.  This helps her in her personal life and in her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal products - dresses and tshirts

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 29 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Sagarejo district with her family: her husband Shalva and their 7-year-old daughter, who studies in the village school. Shalva works as a private security guard and gets a salary. Nanuli has a milking cow; she milks it twice in a day and sells the milk in nearby villages. She also has a vineyard; she and Shalva produce wine in the autumn. They sell grapes and wine on the local market. The family's average monthly income is 700 Lari. 

Nanuli requested a loan for purchasing three calves. She wants to raise them.  After they are grown, Nanuli will be able to increase cheese production. She will sell more milk and cheese, and the family will get additional income. With increased income, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 60-year-old woman from the village of Gurjaani in East Georgia. She is a widow and lives with her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. 

Rusudan is busy with agricultural business. She has a plot of land where she grows peaches. She works hard on her plot to get a good harvest. She sells her peaches on the local market. In addition to her agricultural business, she is busy with trading. She buys second-hand cloth in Tbilisi (capital of Georgia) and sells it from her house. She has a lot of customers and sells the goods for a good price. The family's average monthly income is 400 Lari.

Rusudan requested a loan to pay for her granddaughter's studies. With this loan, her granddaughter will be able to graduate from her institute. After graduation, she will start work and will be able to help the family. As a result, living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to finance her granddaughter's studies.

loans.name: Esdras

texts.en:
Esdras is married with five children. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for six years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds and support his labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and support labor costs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 41-year-old single woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be social and jovial. She operates a store where she provides tailoring services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located along a busy road within an urban area, and her primary customers are residents within the area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for lighting in her house. Her business goal is to run a boutique. She plans to make sure that her children are all educated by paying for their school fees, as she is the sole provider of her family.

loans.use: To buy a solar lantern for her family

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, 26 years old, is married to a businessman. She has 2 children, 6 and 3, both attending school. Mariam sells fish in one of the busy streets in their trading center. She buys her stock from a regular fish monger who sometimes lets her buy on credit. Currently, Mariam's main problem is lack of enough capital to expand her business. She also says that since she lacks a refrigerator, her fish at times go bad. Mariam is requesting this first loan with Yehu in order to buy cooking oil, more fish and firewood. She wants to invest in her business. In the coming years, Mariam would like to have a small shop. She intends to use her profits to help her husband with the children's education.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, fish and firewood.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to seven children, four of whom are in school, while the rest are married. Her husband is a fish monger, and they live in their own house. He gets a low income, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay for their children's educational expenses.

For the past two years, Mesalimu has been selling cereals in a small store. She wants to live in better conditions with her family, so she is requesting a 20,000 Kenyan Shillings loan from Yehu to help her purchase sacks of maize and beans.
 
Mesalimu hopes to educate her children so they can become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize and beans

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 29 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Gurjaani District with her family: her husband David, her parents-in-law, and her two children (2 and 4 years old). 

The family members are busy with agricultural business. They have two milking cows and two calves. They produce cheese, some of which is for the family and the rest is sold locally. The family also owns a vineyard; they harvest grapes and sell them on the local market. Along with the agricultural business, Madona is busy with trading. She buys clothes in Tbilisi (capital of Georgia) and sells them in her village. The family's average monthly income is 800 Lari. 

Madona requested a loan to buy additional clothing. She will diversify the assortment that she has for sale and attract new customers. Her sales will increase, and the profit will increase the family's monthly income. As a result, Madona will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 31 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo Jhony, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, a los que cuida con mucho amor. Su casa es propia y se ubica en la localidad de Daniel Hernández.  
Durante las mañanas vende dulces en una escuela de su localidad con un triciclo en el patio de la institución. Ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a esta actividad y según cuenta le va muy bien, pues siempre vende un promedio de 70 nuevos soles, de los cuales tiene que sacar los gastos que invierte en la mercadería como también en el pago diario a la escuela por derechos de venta. Por otro lado, su esposo trabaja en una hacienda cortando pasto para los animales, ahí recibe un sueldo mensual. Pero los sábados y domingos él maneja la motocarro que ellos adquirieron hace algunos años, haciendo transporte de pasajeros, de ello obtienen un dinero extra para el hogar. Ahora necesitan arreglar su vehículo para seguir trabajando con normalidad.

Este es el primer crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo brindado. Llegó a la su grupo por invitación de una de las socias más antiguas y está segura que con el apoyo financiero que reciba podrá incrementar sus ganancias, las que le servirán para adquirir mejoras en su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Bertha invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de nuevos neumáticos para su motocarro y con el dinero restante comprará bebidas y dulces para su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha is 31 years old. She lives with her husband Jhony and together they have four children, whom she cares for very lovingly. She owns her house, which is located in the town of Daniel Hernández.
In the mornings she sells candy in on of her town's schools. She uses a tricycle in the schoolyard of that institution. She's already been in this business for two years and, according to her, it's going very well, since she always sells an average of 70 nuevos soles. From that amount she needs to draw the expenses invested in merchandise as well as the daily payment to the school for the right to sell. In addition, her husband works in a farm cutting pasture for the animals, and he receives a monthly salary for that. However, on Saturdays and Sundays he drives the three-wheeler they purchased a few years ago and transports passengers, which gets them some extra money for the household. Now they need to repair their vehicle in order to keep working as usual.
This is her first loan with MFP and she gives thanks for the support she's gotten. She joined her communal bank by invitation from one of the older members. She's sure that the financial support she'll receive will allow her to increase her profits, which will be used to improve her business. For that reason she pledges to be punctual with her repayments.
Bertha will use the requested amount to purchase new tires for her three-wheeler, and with the rest of the money she will buy beverages and candy for her business.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her three-wheeler taxi and more candy and beverages for her stall.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina tiene 29 años de edad vive en Pucarita Chica, un cantón al sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, está casada con el Señor Julián, con quien tiene dos hijos pequeños, una niña de cinco años y un niño de cuatro años, ella se dedica a la producción de leche y su esposo a la construcción como albañil, son personas responsables y trabajadoras.
Marina cuenta que ella tuvo que dejar la escuela cuando su padre los abandonó a ella y a su madre. Junto con el hermano, la madre se dio a la bebida y Marina tenía que trabajar con las vacas y sacar adelante su familia, ella dice que su madre sufrió mucho por el abandono de sus padre pero que después de unos años se repuso, entonces fue cuando Mariana se fue a trabajar a Argentina junto con su tía. Ella cuenta que no fue fácil ya que tenía 14 años cuando se fue del país y le tocó trabajar de lo que pudo para salir adelante y poder ayudar a su madre con la educación de su hermano. Marina se conoció en Argentina con Julia, quien también se fue a trabajar allá para poder salir adelante ya que en nuestro país no hay fuentes de trabajo y ya como hace seis años atrás volvieron al país y se casaron y se construyeron su propia casa donde viven con sus hijos. Marina trata de ser la mejor madre y esposa ya que su madre no lo fue con ella y sus hermanos.
Marina ya tuvo un crédito anterior, el cual canceló sin problema este nuevo crédito es para la compra de semillas para sembrar alfa alfa para aumentar los insumos para su ganado y de esa manera tener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Marina is 29 years old and lives in Pucarita Chica, a canton to the south of Cochabamba.  She is married to Julian, with whom she has two small children, a girl of five and a boy of four.  She works in the production of milk and her husband in construction as a bricklayer.  The are responsible, hardworking people.

Marina says that she had to leave school when her father abandoned her and her mother.  Together with her brother, her mother started drinking and Marina had to work with the cows and help her family get ahead.  She says that her mother suffered a lot because of the abandonment by her father but that she got better after a few years and that was when Marina went to live in Argentina with her aunt.  She says that it wasn't easy since she was only 14 when she left the country and she had to work to get ahead and to help her mother with the the aducation of her brother.

In Argentina Marina got to know Julian, who also went there to work in order to get ahead since in their country their aren't sources of work, but six years ago they returned to Bolivia and got married and they built their own house where they live with their children.

Marina tries to be a better mother and wife since  her mother wasn't very good with her and her siblings.  

Marina had a prior loan that she paid without problems.  This new loan is to buy seed to sow alfalfa to increase the feed for her livestock and in this way have better production.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seed and feed for cows.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina es oriunda de un municipio donde fabrican calzado y por eso desde muy niña conoció muy bien estos procesos productivos, pues su familia los practicaba. Así fue como, una vez llegara  a la ciudad a estudiar en la Universidad, decidiera apoyar sus ingresos vendiendo lo que producían en su pueblo, en un principio tuvo devoluciones que se convirtieron en un gran desafío, pero poco a poco, fue conociendo a su clientela  y ha logrado superar esa situación y avanzar en su negocio. Su meta es duplicar sus  ventas pues su mayor merado se encuentra en los estudiantes de la universidad donde estudia y últimamente ha tenido que comprar a crédito y a precios no muy competitivos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado que tiene encargado y necesita hacerlo de contado para ganar descuentos y ofrecer un mejor precio a sus clientes, para continuar la fidelización de ellos.
texts.en: Lina comes from a shoemaking town. She became familiar with these manufacturing processes when she was very young, because her family was in this line of work. So once she came into the city to go to college, she decided to support herself by selling the products from her village. In the beginning she had refunds that became a big challenge, but gradually she got to know her clientele, and she succeeded in overcoming this situation and moving forward in her business. Her goal is to double her sales, because her biggest market is the students of the university where she studies. Lately she has had to buy on credit, at prices that are not so competitive. That's the reason why she requests a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase shoes that are already ordered. She needs to pay by cash in order to get discounts and offer her customers a better price, so that she can continue to retain them.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been farming for 12 years in her rural home in Nyamira, where she stays with her husband and their two children. Her farm produces milk, tea, coffee and bananas, which she sells to the local market.

Grace has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a modern dairy unit in her farm. She hopes to gain more income and expand her business as well as educate her children. Her future plan is to buy more parcels of land to expand her farming. Grace says that lack of developed local markets and occasional droughts remain her major challenges.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is married and has six children aged between 7 and 22, all attending schools. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years and his wife is also a maize farmer. Elie would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor to get the best harvest. He want to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao est un homme marié et père 2 enfants âgés respectivement de 6 et 8 ans.  Chauffeur de formation, il en exerce le métier. Malheureusement il ne peut plus exercer son activité parce que son véhicule est en panne. Il souhaite un crédit en vue d’acheter un nouveau moteur de marque TOYOTA. Il espère qu’avec ce crédit il pourra reprendre normalement ses activités et laisser libre court à ses rêves.
texts.en: Yao is married and the father of two children ages 6 and 8. He was trained as a driver, and that is his current job. Unfortunately he can't work any more because his vehicle is broken down. He would like to get a loan in order to buy a new Toyota engine. He hopes that the loan will allow him to work again and fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his vehicle.

loans.name: Isaul Antonio

texts.es:
Isaul sigue laborando como cadete de taxi, su hijo de 6 años, cursa la primaria, su esposa trabaja como cajera, ambos desean tener una casa con seguridad y digna para su hijo, aunque son muy sencillos económicamente esperan lograr el propósito.
Ya que se le ha hecho más fácil, ahora que están obteniendo crédito para mejorar su condición de vida al tener un casa segura. Con el crédito anterior era para comenzar a levantar de piedra el arranque, pero se le presento la dificultad de su letrina, en donde tuvo que hacer otro sumidero y cerrarla completamente, teniendo privacidad e higiene en su hogar. Es por eso con este nuevo préstamo comenzara a construir su cuarto. Materiales a comprar: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y otros materiales.
texts.en:
Isaul continues to work as a taxi driver. His 6-year-old child is in primary school, and his wife works as a cashier. Both want to have a house that is safe and appropriate for their child, and although they are of very simple means economically, they hope to achieve their goal. 

This has become easier now that they are obtaining a loan to improve their living conditions and have a secure house. The previous loan was aimed at laying the blocks to build the structure, but the latrine became a problem, and he had to close it off completely and create another sewer connection in order to have privacy and hygiene in his home. Because of this, with this new loan he will start to build the room. The materials to be purchased are blocks, sand, cement, iron and other materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and build a room.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is married with four children aged between 4 and 13. All of the children attend schools. Her husband is also a maize farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 18 years. She would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she wants to make more savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 56 years old. She is a widow and lives alone in a small village in the Gurjaani District. Lili is busy with an agricultural business. In particular, she is busy with poultry farming.  She sells chickens, hens, cocks and eggs on the local open market.  She also has a plot of land. Lili’s total average monthly income is 650 Lari.

Lili requested a loan for cultivation of her agricultural land. After cultivation she plans to plant nuts there. She will work hard on her plot to receive a good harvest. Lili will sell the harvested products on the local open market and hopes to get an expected income. With increased income she will be able to repair the house. Taking into account the above mentioned, Lili will be able to spend her evenings after hard working days in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to cultivate land and plant nuts.

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es: El señor Pedro Luis tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la Zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la casa de sus padres y trabaja con su vehículo como radio taxi de una empresa local. Es estudiante en un instituto en la carrera de técnico en mecánica automotriz él se paga solo los estudios. Es por esa razón que trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y después se va sus clases. Pedro tuvo que dejar el año pasado el transporte porque sus madre se enfermó. Luis y  su padre trabajaban en dos turnos por el día y la noche, él dice que gracias a Dios su madre salió adelante y ahora está trabajando como siempre. Él requiere el crédito para hacer arreglar el motor de su vehículo y de esa manera no tener problemas para poder terminar su carrera. En la gestión pasada se le otorgó el crédito para compra del gas de su vehículo. Luis es una persona responsable y siempre canceló sin problemas.
texts.en: Pedro Luis is 23 years old. He lives in his parents' house in the southern area of the town of Cochabamba. He uses his own vehicle to work as a radio taxi for a local company. He studies in an institute for a career as an auto mechanic technician, and he pays for his own studies. For that purpose he works everyday from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., and then he goes to his classes. Pedro had to quit transportation last year, because his mother became ill. Luis and his father worked in shifts during the day and night, and he says that, thank God, his mother got better and now she's working as usual. He requests the loan in order to fix the engine in his vehicle so that he doesn't have any problems finishing his taxi rides. In the previous cycle he got a loan for purchasing gas for his vehicle. Luis is a responsible person and has always repaid without problems.

loans.use: to purchase spare engine parts and to pay for repair services.

loans.name: Isaac Misael

texts.es:
Isaac, hombre trabajador  cada día labora como cadete, para seguir con sus planes de construcción, junto a su esposa, siguen esforzándose ella continua laborando en servicios domésticos con el fin  de ir acondicionando su pequeña casa.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo, repara el techo, techo que no es tan viejo pero se le pasa el agua, en donde lo quitara todo y comenzara hacer nueva la construcción del techo. Comprara láminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Isaac is a hard working man. Every day he works as a driver in order to continue with his construction plans. Together with his wife they are continuing their efforts. She is still working as a housekeeper in order to get her small house set up. 

Today with this new loan Isaac will repair the roof. It's not that old, but it leaks water. He will take out everything where it leaks, and start with new construction of the roof. He will buy zinc sheeting, lumber, and nails and start the job.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, beams, and nails to improve the roof.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 36 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in the Gurjaani district with her large family: her husband, Zaza, her two children (both attending the local school), her mother-in-law and her husband's aunt, both pensioners. Nino and Zaza earn their living through their agricultural business, in particular, livestock. They have pigs and sell piglets. They are very hardworking people and take good care of their livestock. The family owns a plot of land, where they grow peaches. Nino and Zaza are also busy selling goods. They buy agricultural products from local farmers and sell them on the local open market. The family's total average monthly income is 1,000 GEL.

Nino has requested a loan to purchase two pigs and more agricultural products for selling. She will diversify her assortment of fruits and vegetables and attract new customers, thus expanding her businesses. She will be able to sell more piglets and more products, which will increase the sales from her businesses. These expansions will increase the family's income accordingly. With increased income, Nino and Zaza will be able to repair their house and finance their children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and agricultural products for selling

loans.name: La Lumiere 1 Group

texts.en:
Gabriel, age 45, is married with 7 children, ages 7 to 30 years old. She has 4 children currently attending school. She also cares for her elderly father. Gabriel is representing the La Lumiere 1 group. She runs a small bakery where she makes beignets. She has been selling beignets in a local market in Brazzaville for 20 years! She will use the loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, corn, and firewood. Her business strategy is simple: to make good tasting beignets. She also sells them at a competitive price. 

Gabriel has received 1 previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to use some of her business profits to enable her children to study abroad.

loans.use: to pay for flour, oil, sugar, corn, and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle transport for his business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. Magdalena es un ejemplo de superación y perseverancia ya que ella junto con su esposo han podido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos luchando para que nada les falte, el es chofer de una línea de camiones de la ciudad y ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes. Magdalena sabe que con esta actividad ayuda  a su familia a salir adelante es por eso que en esta ocasión pide nuestra ayuda para la compra de mercancía ya que quiere hacer que su negocio crezca y de esta manera aportar más al gasto familiar y ofrecerles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades de superación al estudiar en escuelas de calidad.
texts.en: Magdalena is an example of overcoming obstacles and perseverance since she and her husband have been able to get their three children ahead.  They did this by fighting so that the family lacks nothing.  He is a city bus driver and she has her grocery business.  Magdalena knows that with this business she can help her family live better and that is why she is requesting our help.  She wants to buy merchandise since she would like her business to grow and carry more of the family expenses, and to offer her youngest children opportunities to get ahead and study in good quality schools.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is married and has two children, ages 9 and 12. Her husband works as a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for ten years. 

She wants the loan to buy more seeds, for seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or future planting), and for support labor to get the best harvest. She wants to use the profits to build a house and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for more seeds, seed multiplication, and labor costs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with no children yet. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 12 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate his house and make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is married with five children between the ages of 7 and 20. All of the children attend schools. He has been a maize farmer for 6 years and his wife is also a maize farmer. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, practice seed multiplication and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate their house and pay school fees for the children. He is holding a Kiva profile form after filling it out.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Alejandro Nicanor

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, tiene 2 hijos quienes han sido su motivo y razón para seguir adelante y luchar para que ello sean hombres de bien, lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja; Alejandro siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta; lamentablemente cuando era muy joven perdió a sus padres, desde entonces por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo al deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato par compartir con su familia.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y a las buenas enseñanzas que le dejo su Padre, desde hace varios años Alejandro puso en marcha su pequeño taller de pintado de autos, él trabaja un aproximado de 11 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 5 cliente; Alejandro se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que sus clientes lo recomiendan por sus buenos trabajos y por su trato amable y respetuoso.
Alejandro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de planchado, así también podrá renovar sus materiales de trabajo, tales como: pintura, pistola de pintar, lijas, thiner, barnices, entre otros; de esta manera Alejandro tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado con materiales adecuados para realizar sus trabajos, así él podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales desea poder dar los acabados que requiere su vivienda y así en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder tener otro taller de pintado de autos donde el pueda administrarlo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 55 years old. He lives in the city of Pisco and has 2 children who have been his motivation and reason to press forward and struggle so that they become good men. Unfortunately for various reasons he separated from his wife some years ago. Alejandro has always been a very happy, hard-working and enthusiastic person. Sadly, when he was very young he lost his parents. Since then, due to the need of work and to afford his expenses he could not pursue a professional career, but he would have liked to study mechanical engineering. In his free time he likes to dedicate a little time to sports and on some occasions cook a delicious rice with duck to share with his family.

Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and good lessons from his father, Alejandro for some years has run his small garage painting cars. He works about 11 hours daily, during which he can attend to up to 5 customers. Alejandro is very happy doing his work and believes that his business is doing well due to his clients recommending him for his good work and for his kind and respectful treatment.

Alejandro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided he will be able to purchase welding and renovation materials such as: paint, paint gun, sand paper, paint thinner, varnishes among others. In this way, Alejandro would have his business better conditioned with adequate materials to do his jobs. In this way he will be able to increase his sales and economic income, with which he wants to be able to give his housing the finishes it requires and in the not too distant future he hopes to be able to have another shop for painting cars that he can manage.

loans.use: to buy materials welding and renovation materials such as: paint, paint gun, sand paper, paint thinner, varnishes, etc.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is 34 years old and lives in the town of Tiribe in the Kenyan coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Kwekwe has been working hard to manage her small business of selling omena (small dried fish). 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more dried fish for resale, and will help Kwekwe to generate greater profits and improve her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Phocas

texts.en:
Phocas is married with six children. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 15 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to build a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is a 66-year-old widow. She lives alone in a small village of the Gurjaani district. Eter is busy with farming. She has a vineyard and a plot of land where maize is grown. She is especially busy in the spring and summer seasons in order to get a good harvest. She sells harvested grapes and maize on the local open market. Eter’s total average monthly income is 300 Lari. She works hard, but her income is hardly enough for food and for everyday expenses. She cannot make savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or renovation of the house.

Eter requested a loan for cultivation and fertilization of agricultural land. After properly done seasonal agricultural work, Eter hopes to get a larger and better quality harvest, which will be sold for a good price. This will increase her income. The increased income will be used to repair the house, because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. Taking into account the above-mentioned, Eter will be able to spend the winter in a warm house and won’t be afraid of snow and rain.

loans.use: to cultivate and fertilize her agricultural land.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Ildephonse is married with one child of three years. He has been a maize farmer for 8 years. His wife is also a maize farmer. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, practice seed multiplication and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate the house and make more savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, practice seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Mtsoma

texts.en:
Mtsoma, 31, stands out as a very responsible and hardworking husband who looks after the well-being of his family, which consists of his wife and one son who is still an infant. They are his main reason for working harder every day. They all live together in their own house. Mtsoma has a kiosk in his home, selling consumer goods.

He is seeking a loan so that he can invest in his business. He hopes this will allow him to offer a better service and keep his customers very happy so that he can always count on them. With the loan, he plans to purchase bales of maize flour, sugar and sweets. Mtsoma has a thatched house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase bales of maize flour, sugar and sweets.

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
En el sector del Colegio Uruguay en la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Buenos Amigos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julia, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis  hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa pero independiente. Su esposo es no vidente y le ayuda a ella en su negocio.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante junto a su familia, ella hace mucho tiempo aprendió corte y confección y gracias a estos conocimientos ella puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura el cual lo ha ido surtiendo de mercadería para vender a sus clientes, ella también vende ropa, bisutería entre otras cosas, negocio en el cual le ayuda su querido esposo, lleva más de 30 años con su negocio y es como ella ha podido ayudara a su marido  y sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisutería, telas y otros materiales para confeccionar sus prendas. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y espera seguir por mucho tiempo más en el mismo.

Su sueño es tener salud ante todo.
texts.en:
The members of the "Buenos Amigos" (Good Friends) communal bank meet every two weeks in the Colegio Uruguay sector of Portoviejo, a lovely and hospitable city known as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds."  

This is where we met Julia. She is 60, married, and has six children, all adults. Two of them still live in her house, but are independent. Her husband is blind and helps her in her business.

Our friend is a woman who is constantly striving, and who has always liked to work, so that she and her family can get ahead in life.

She learned dressmaking a long time ago, and thanks to this knowledge set up a small sewing workshop in her home. Here she has been gradually stocking up on merchandise to sell to her customers. She also sells clothing, costume jewelry and other items, a business in which her dear husband helps her. 

She has been in her business for more than 30 years, and it is how she has been able to help her husband and raise her family.

This loan is to buy clothing and costume jewelry, as well as fabric and other materials for making her clothing. This is her first loan as part of the communal bank, and she hopes to remain in it for a very long time.

Her dream, above all, is to have good health.

loans.use: To buy clothing, costume jewelry, fabric and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 42-year-old single woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be determined and caring. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a favorable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds for improving the business and the delay of payments from customers. 

She will use the Kes 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for using at her business premises. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have diversified her business into rental house services.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern to use in her business at night.

loans.name: Nzungu

texts.en:
Nzungu usually sells fruits and vegetables of different varieties, such as bananas, mangoes, tomatoes, etc. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Another source of income includes a contribution from his spouse and also sales from farm produce.

Now Nzungu would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase more fruits and vegetables, and also fertilizers for his small vegetable garden. For this purpose he applied for a loan of Ksh 20,000. He hopes that the loan will improve his family's life.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables and fertilizer.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is married with three children aged between 6 and 12. All of the children attend schools. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene is sixty-one years old and married. Her six children are grown, and none of them are attending school. All of her family lives in the northeastern part of Albania, across the beautiful Adriatic coastline. Lene has been in the livestock and poultry business for the past twenty years and the business has been doing well.  Thanks to her personable nature and service skills she has been able to establish a large clientele. People in the region speak very highly of her.

This is her third time requesting a loan, with the previous ones being paid off. The loan she is requesting now is a Kiva loan via the VFA institution.  She plans to use it to buy feed for the animals. Lene is very appreciative of all potential Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy animal and poultry feed.

loans.name: Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTI” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roxana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de licores, venta de tarjetas, venta de ropa americana, venta de vitrinas, venta de muebles, vidriería de aluminio.

La señora Roxana, indica que hace cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería desde hace varios años, mismo que aprendió de anteriores trabajos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que comprará de las barracas de la Cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. "INTI" will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Focal Center of Collpani. It is comprised of 7 members and is directed by a steering committee of which Roxana is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association lead are varied. Among them we have: Clothing sales, liquor sales, card sales, sales of American clothes, sales of cabinets, furniture sales, and aluminum glassware.

Roxana says that it has been five cycles of friends entering by invitation that brings together Pro Mujer. She currently has a carpentry business which started some years ago, when she learned from previous work.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to purchase wood), which she will buy from the stalls of the City of El Alto and after treating it she will sell it in her stall in the city of El Alto. Through this work she will generate resources in order to support her family, as she is married and has 4 children.

When she was asked what she like about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Deo-Gracias 3 Group

texts.en:
Solange, age 44, is married with 4 children, ages 8 to 22 years old. All 4 of her children are attending school. She is representing the Deo-Gracias 3 group. Solange owns and operates a bakery where she primarily bakes cakes. She has had this business for 5 years.
