He believes that the additional income he earns as a result of this loan will enable him to provide for the basic needs of his family and to purchase additional stock. His main challenge has been theft and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Malila Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her early late 20s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  She has had a salon business since 2006.  She works from 7.00 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the salon, paid school fees, household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more salon equipments and a generator for her beauty salon. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Catherine, will share this loan with her loan group "Malila" with 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipments and a generator for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He has three children and runs a motor cycle transport business in the area. This mode of transport is preferred by many who lack enough money for transport and also for movement within short distances in the area. He began the business two years ago and he is also employed elsewhere.

Douglas was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to repair his motor cycle. He will save the additional income obtained from this loan. The challenge with the current business is theft of bicycles and lack of customers at certain times of the day.

loans.use: to repair his motor cycle.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, who lives in the Changamwe, Kenya, is a water vendor. She is married. She supplies water to her neighborhoods. This idea came from the fact that water delivery in the area is a challenge. She began the business three years ago and also sells doughnuts.

A loan of KSH 83,450 will help Mariam purchase more stock to make doughnuts. Apart from the high cost of living and the reduced disposable income of many customers of such businesses, Mariam has been facing the challenge of a lack of storage tanks -- a problem she sees solved by the purchasing of these water tanks. She also intends to apply for a water meter and sell water from a tap instead of pushing a handcart.

loans.use: to buy stock for making doughnuts.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 45 years old and is married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Phoebe has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

She is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her general store. In the future, Phoebe would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a fruit vending business in the Philippines for the past 15 years. 

Rowena has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional fruits for her business

loans.name: Willison

texts.en:
Willison lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He owns a cafe which has been in existence for twenty five years and employs two other people. He is married and has six children. He started the business from his personal savings and assistance from friends. 
A loan of 104,750 Kenya shillings will help him purchase more chairs and tables for his cafe and thereby also open another cafe. The challenge facing the business is high cost of materials and the overall inflation. 
Willison states that the additional income from this business will help him purchase a pick up track to supply meet the daily family requirements and also improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables for his cafe.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a married mother of six children; five of whom are in school. 

Linet owns a nursery/preschool, which has been in operation for a year. She walked from house to house inviting students to join her school. Most of these students could not afford fees. The school has been in operation for one term (three months but has a very promising future and the enrollments keep increasing).

Linet learnt of Milango from the Company employees and decided to join in order to access credit. Linet is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase chairs, writing boards, chalk and books. She aspires to increase the number of streams in future despite the initial low enrollment and will use the extra income to start other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, writing boards, chalk, and books.

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en:
Mwanashabani is 26 and has been married for more than six years. She and her husband have two children, all of whom are in school. Mwanashabani operates a tailoring business in Likoni, a small town in the city of Mombasa. She has operated this business for four years. She started her business, because she studied tailoring and dress-making before she started working. She greatly enjoys tending to her clients, so she decided to open her own tailoring shop. She is now requesting a loan for the purchase of clothing materials and thread. These are the items that she uses the most in her tailoring.

Mwanashabani and her husband, Salim, are very grateful to the microfinance institution, because if things keep going as they have been, the quality of everything in the tailoring shop will increase. This makes them very happy, because their children will not have to go without education in the future. Currently, they live in their own house that has piped water but no electricity, though they hope to have this amenity very soon. She faces a major challenge of market competition.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and thread.

loans.name: Terezia

texts.en:
Terezia, who is married and lives with her husband in Samburu, the city of Mombasa, is a shopkeeper. She owns a grocery store, which is very well known in the neighborhood. She started her business from her own savings and then, thanks to her work and sacrifice, her grocery store grew and her business is now self-sufficient, using only the profits it returns. Terezia defines herself as a very hard-working person and someone who is very keen to get ahead and to better herself.

Terezia is asking for this loan to stock her store with baked goods, noodles, fizzy drinks, rice and other supplies, which are the products that generate the biggest profits. With these products, she will be able to meet demand as well as improve her income.

loans.use: to stock her store with baked goods, noodles, fizzy drinks, and rice.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is single with two children who are adults and independent. For the past ten years she has worked as a tailor. She also sells coconuts at the market on the side.

Mwanamisi started working for others as a tailor while still very young. During that time she saved up some capital and was able to start her own business. She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead. 

Mwanamisi is asking for a 20,000 KES loan from Yehu to buy cloth and coconuts so as to have a good supply of stock available to offer her customers. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity to take out a loan because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy cloth and coconuts.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 43 years old and is married with five children. She earns a living with a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Sarah has been in the pig fattening business for eight years and earns additional income from selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and additional pigs to raise. Sarah is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years. Carolina earns additional income from selling food.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Carolina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell in her business

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a single woman and has no child. She has a well-stocked restaurant business that is in a good location and helps her make the daily income she needs.

Mishi says she began selling household products, but then changed to her current business, which is going very well. On the other hand. she also operates a cyber cafe where she earns her other source of income. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who makes every effort to earn income.

She is requesting a loan to buy meat, beverages, flour, chicken, and other items to have enough inventory on hand to continue making the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, beverages, flour, chicken, and other items for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Bibi bought sacks of mangoes and coconuts that she sold, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because she wants to expand to a vegetable stall business, and Bibi's working capital is insufficient to start up another business.

This is the reason why she is requesting a Kiva loan  to buy fruits and vegetables from the harvest, at a good price and above all very fresh. Bibi tells the lenders that her Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to start a vegetable stall business.

loans.name: Ntenga

texts.en:
Ntenga is a married woman who is 40 years old, with three boys and three girls. She is a devoted woman who is determined to ensure that her children have quality education. Two girls are in class seven and four; while two boys are in class four and two.

She has been selling mats and baskets for over eight years, selling them at the nearby market. Ntenga is married to an industrious husband who is a farmer and she helps her husband in catering for the basic needs of the family. They dwell in their own house thatched with palm fronds and which lacks electricity and piped water.

Despite her hard work, she faces a challenge of high transport cost and also lack of enough capital to expand her business. She is therefore applying for a loan amounting to Ksh 30,000 to purchase more mats and baskets for sale. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their support, hoping that it will boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mats and baskets for sale.

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nasoro is an industrious man who sells natural medicines in his neighborhood. He is taking out another loan to expand his existing business.

Thanks to his business, which has been running for more than 10 years, he can educate his children. He has a dream of seeing that the children who are in school reach University.

Nasoro is applying a second loan of KSH 12,745 to purchase more stock of natural medicines to sell.

Thanks to Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity given to him.

loans.use: to purchase more natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 28 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  The couple does not yet have any children.

Isaac is a member of Yehu microfinance, located in the coastal region of Kenya.  He lives with his beautiful wife in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.  

Isaac is a shoemaker and designer, and he sells to the general public. He is requesting another loan to buy leather and some decorations. With the help of this loan, he will be able to expand his business. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to save money and start this current business.

Isaac’s dream is to open a shoe shop in future. In his free time he enjoys spending time with his friends.

loans.use: to buy leather and some decorations.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 29 years old with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Eliza has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 10 years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Eliza has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her general store. Eliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 39 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Marivel has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 16 years and also earns an income from selling Avon.

Marivel has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her general store. Marivel aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items for her general store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. Nancy earns additional income from selling food.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Nancy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 35-year-old married woman living in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She works hard to support her husband and their six children aged 15, 12, 9, 7, 3 and a seven-month-old baby. 

Gemma has been in a fishing business for five years with her husband. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy school supplies for her children, like notebooks, and to buy materials for the renovation of their house, like wood, cement, nails, etc. 

In the future, Gemma hopes to increase her husband's fishing catch so that she has something to sell at the market. She is positive that the loan will be a great help for their children's education which is her foremost concern and for the renovation of their house.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and to buy materials for house renovation

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a café owner living in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She is single and has two school-going children. Pamela started the business from her personal savings. The area has a high number of residents due to the low cost housing and this makes such a business quite a profitable venture. She employs two other people. Her business has been running for five years and has faced the challenges of price fluctuations and the high cost of materials.

Pamela would like to maximize her income. She was introduced to Milango by an employee and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock such as sugar, beans, cooking oil and charcoal. Her ambition is to make her café a world class shop in the near future. She believes the additional income from this loan will help to improve her family’s living standard and to provide her children an education.

loans.use: buy stock for her cafe

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en: Hoi is requesting a new loan to buy materials for producing artificial flowers. Hoi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to make artificial flowers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy materials to increase her production of clothes. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will help her to expand her business, earn more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to increase her production of clothes.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi 50 ans, est mariée sans enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits divers et est l’épouse d’un commerçant. Elle achète sur commande de la volaille, du charbon de bois, du maïs, du haricot etc… Opérant avec WAGES depuis plusieurs années, elle sollicite ce onzième crédit dans le but d’étendre son activité. Elle pense donc s’approvisionner en marchandises nécessaires à son commerce. Elle compte reverser les profits générés par son commerce sur son compte sous forme d’épargne. Elle espère devenir grossiste et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 50 years old and married, with no children. She sells various products and her husband is a shopkeeper. She places orders for poultry, charcoal, corn, beans, etc...

She has been working with WAGES for several years now, and she is seeking her eleventh loan to help expand her business. She plans to use the loan to stock up on essential goods for her business.

She plans to put the profits generated by her business into her savings account. She hopes to someday become a wholesaler and to start a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy poultry, corn, and other various items

loans.name: Bao

texts.en: Bao is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as beverages and coffee, to restock his shop. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages and coffee in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more gas tanks from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Hoang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more gas tanks from different suppliers for resale.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Ana es una humilde habitante de León, de 47 años de edad, madre de dos hijos, ella clienta Kiva de oficio comerciante se  dedica a la venta de tortillas desde los 26 años  de edad. Ana dice que su primer préstamo fue de gran ayuda porque pudo invertir en su negocio además de las ganancias que obtuvo logro mejorar  las condiciones del local, utilizo el crédito para comprar maíz y leña para hacer tortillas, pero ella quiere diversificarse aun mas en productos para su negocio ya que la demanda es mucha  es por esta razón que hoy requiere del crédito al igual para comprar maíz y leña para su negocio pues los productos van subiendo de precios  y necesita estar preparada para la temporada de lluvia, ella estima que esta nueva inversión será de ayuda porque podrá  comprar la materia prima necesaria para el negocio, podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, Ana dice que su siguiente paso es comprar zinc y maíz para ir guardando para las temporadas difíciles, ella espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para mantener su trabajo ya que es algo que le gusta hacer y con lo que ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en: Ana is a humble woman who lives in León. She is 47 years old and has two children. She is a Kiva client who, as a trader, has been selling tortillas since she was 26 years old.  Ana says that her first loan was a great help as she was able to invest in her business. In addition to the profit that she made, she succeeded in improving the conditions of her business premises. She used the loan to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas. However, she would like to diversify further in products offered by her business, as demand is high. That is why she now needs a loan, like the previous one, to buy corn and firewood for her business, because products are going up in price and she needs to be prepared for the rainy season. She considers that this new investment will help because she can buy the raw materials required for the business, and she will be able to meet the needs of her customers. Ana says that her next step is to buy zinc and corn to put aside for use during difficult times. She hopes to have the support of Kiva to allow her to continue with her work, since it is something that she loves doing and that has enabled her to get on in life.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Campeonas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO CAMPEONAS ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO, ESTA INTEGRADO POR 7 MUJERES. TODAS SON VECINAS LA MAYORIA DE ELLAS,SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO.TODAS ELLAS TIENE SUEÑOS DE LLEGAR A TENER UN NEGOCIO BIEN ESTABLECIDO YA QUE LA MAYORIA DE ELLAS SON DE BAJOS RECURSOS,CASI NINGUNA TUVO ESTUDIOS,POR ESO SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO 
COMO VENTA DE COMIDAS,ROPA Y CALZADO.
BERTHA ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES TIENE 52 AÑOS, ES MADRE DE 5 HIJOS DE 37,34,28,23 Y 24 AÑOS TODOS YA CASADOS.
ELLA UTILIZARA SU CREDITO PARA SURTIR CALZADO DE TEMPORADA.
EL SUEÑO DE BERTHA ES LLEGAR A TENER UNA ZAPATERIA EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. YA QUE ELLA VENDE EN SU CASA, Y ESTA MUY COMPLICADO PARA LOS CLIENTES, PORQUE  ELLA VIVE EN EL CERRO Y NO SUBEN LOS AUTOMOVILES Y HAY QUE LLAGAR CAMINANDO. Y EN TIEMPOS DE LLUVIA SE COMPLICA MAS.
A BERTHA LE GUSTARIA QUE SUS HIJOS TRABAJEN CON ELLA Y DESPUES HEREDARLES EL NEGOCIO A SUS HIJOS Y NIETOS.
texts.en:
The Campeonas ("Champions") group, affiliated with Credituyo, consists of seven women.  All are neighbors, and most of them are traders.  They all dream of having a well-established business, but they all have few resources, and practically none of them have any education.  This is why they work selling food, clothing, and shoes.

Bertha is one of the group's members.  She is 52 and has five children, who are 37,34,28,23 and 24.  All her children are married. She will use her loan to buy seasonal footwear.

Bertha's dream is to be able to have a shoe store in the center of her city.  At the moment, she sells from home, and it is very complicated for her clients because she lives on a hill, and since automobiles cannot climb it, her clients have to walk up.  When it rains, it is even worse.

Bertha would like her children to work with her and for her children and grandchildren to inherit the business.

loans.use: to stock seasonal footwear.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Doña Yadira, reside en el departamento de Masaya, es comerciante desde hace 8 años, su negocio consiste en un taller de zapatería en  el que junto con su esposo se encargan de echar a andar el negocio, cuenta con tres trabajadores que laboran en el taller ubicado en su casa de habitación, entre los que se mencionan el calzado que elaboran es zapatos de vestir para niñas y  para damas. Doña Yadira mujer emprendedora ya que no solo maneja el taller de calzado sino que también  es costurera de ropa artesanal y  también tiene ese medio de trabajo el cual lo desempeña con mucho orgullo, comenta que no le gusta estar en un solo punto sino que le gusta innovar, para ofrecer a sus clientes un producto de excelente calidad. Se presenta nuevamente a nuestra oficina Ceprodel y solicitar un financiamiento que le permita suministrar de materia prima sus negocio y poder cumplir con la demanda que siente a engrandecido. Considera que sus ventas han incrementado y mejorado sus ingresos, de tal manera que le esta permitiendo dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Yadira lives in the department of Masaya. She has worked as a storekeeper for the last eight years. Her business consists of a footwear workshop, set up and run by her and her husband. She has three employees working in the footwear workshop, which is located in her home. Among others, they make dress shoes for girls and ladies. Señora Yadira is an enterprising woman who not only runs the footwear workshop, but also works as a seamstress of handmade clothing and is very proud of this work. She says that she does not like to limit herself to just one thing, but likes to be innovative, to offer her customers a product of excellent quality. Once again, she has applied to our CEPRODEL office for a loan that would allow her to purchase raw materials for her business and meet the demand that she feels is on the increase. She believes that her sales and income have increased, thus enabling her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy soles for girls' shoes, white and yellow glue, linings, trimming and fabrics.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José es una persona trabajadora y muy  responsable la cual se esfuerza  día  con día  por  sacar  adelante  a su   familia, el se  dedica  a la  elaboración y  venta  de   pan   dulce  la  cual   realiza  por las  calles  de la  localidad   además  de  surtir  de su  producto  a  las  tiendas  de abarrotes, el a  lo largo de sus  créditos  se  ha   distinguido por  tener una excelente  cultura  de  pagos, se acerco   nuevamente  a la  institución ya  que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de  materia  prima para   seguir  elaborando  el  pan, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la  realización de sus proyecto  ya que  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su   negocio.
texts.en: José is a hardworking and very responsible person, who battles every day so his family can get ahead.  He makes pastry, which he sells in the streets of his neighborhood, as well as supplying his product to grocery stores.  He has an excellent payment history for his previous loans.  He now needs a loan to buy raw materials to make his pastry.  He is grateful for the opportunity that this loan gives him to realize his projects and to allow his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make pastry.

loans.name: Roger Francisco

texts.es:
Roger tiene la edad de 21 años, soltero, reside en el departamento de Masaya, cuenta que a raíz de que su mamá tubo que viajar a otro país para poder mantenerlos a el y su hermana,  decidió emprender su propio negocio, su mamá le facilito el capital para poder iniciar,  es una pulpería y la  tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, gracias a esa iniciativa a salido adelante con su hermana,  es un joven trabajador que desde pequeño a tenido que trabajar para ayudar a su familia. Actualmente mira que en su negocio ha ido aumentando la demanda por lo que necesita invertirle más.
Se acerca a nuestras oficinas Ceprodel para adquirir un préstamo que le permita reabastecer  en productos su negocio. El cual piensa que le servirá de mucha ayuda para incrementar sus ventas y de igual manera expandir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Roger is 21 and single.  He lives in the department of Masaya. Because his mother had to travel to another country in order to support him and his sister, he decided to open his own business.  His mother gave him the start-up capital.  He has a grocery story located in his house.  Thanks to his initiative, he and his sister are getting ahead.  He is a young man who has had to work since a very young age to help his family.  

He now needs to invest more in his business because demand has increased.  He has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel to seek a loan to restock the products in his shop.  This financing will allow him to increase his sales and thus to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, toilet paper, wood, costume jewelery, lingerie, and perfume.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. María Victoria de 57 años de edad se dedica a la costura y venta de zapatos, ella es divorciada y vive sola pero ha mantenido la fuerza para salir adelante, el deseo de superación y sus hijos son lo que la siguen manteniendo fuerte día a día. Sus hijos son casados y viven fuera de la ciudad pero siguen apoyando a su mama de diversas maneras.  Recientemente María  cambio de domicilio y esto ha generado que las maquinas de coser que tiene se maltraten, en esta ocasión ella pide de nuestra ayuda para dar mantenimiento a las maquinas que tiene y comprar nuevas ya que su negocio está en crecimiento.
texts.en: Señora María Victoria is 57 years old. She works as a seamstress and she also sells shoes. She is divorced and lives alone, but has had the strength to move on in life. Her children and her desire to overcome her difficulties are what maintain her strength from day to day. Her children are married and live out of town, but they still support their mom in various ways. María moved house recently and her sewing machines were handled roughly during the move. She is therefore asking for our help with the maintenance of these machines and with the purchase of new machines, as her business is growing.

loans.use: to maintain her own sewing machines and buy new ones.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en: Thi is requesting a new loan to buy and process waste materials for recycling and sale to wholesalers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and process waste materials for recycling

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia  de 45 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos tres de ellos fallecidos y cuatro están ya independizados, Doña Virginia se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de ropa nueva y radica en la comunidad de el Tular Nacaome, Valle.
El préstamo que Doña Virginia esta solicitando es de 10,000.00 lempiras, lo necesita para comprar ropa interior y ropa americana (Fardos Usados), con las ganancias de este préstamo ella pretende seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo y seguir mejorando su condición de vida.
Con apoyo del préstamo desea  lograr su objetivo que es surtir Su negocio y realizar sus sueños de mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old. She is the mother of 7 children. Three of them pased away and four of them are grown. Virginia  has sold new clothes for 2 years and lives in the community of Tular Nacaome, Valle.

The loan that Virginia is asking for is for 10,000.00 lempiras. She needs it to buy underwear and American clothing (used). With the earnings from this loan she intends on continuing to increase her working capital and improving her quality of life.

With the support of the loan she hopes to acieve her goal of stocking her business and making her dream of improving her home come true.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2012

loans.use: to buy underwear and American clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.
He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps and shampoos to stock his general store

loans.name: Crosalita

texts.en:
Crosalita has been a farmer for 15 years now. She is from Talibon Bohol. She is married with two grown children. Together with her husband, she works in their rice field for this is their only source of livelihood. 

Right now, Crosalita is in need of additional capital to make her business successful. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pay the labor fees of the hired help. She is motivated to continue working on her farm so she will not have to depend on her grown children for her personal needs. Her profit from farming will be used for the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pay for labor fees

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 43 years old and is married. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Mai and her husband earn an income to support their family by running a general store. They sell a lot of household items such as shampoo, plastic items and camp beds. Mai intends to use her loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of plastic products to sell from her store. 

Mai hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of plastic products to sell from her store

loans.name: Wyne

texts.en:
Wyne is married with 4 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Wyne owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 5,700 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Wyne has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Wyne's plan is to save her returns in order to buy another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Fausta Karolina

texts.es:
La señora Fausta de 32 años de edad es madre de tres hijos y vive con su conyugue quien es comerciante, ellos alquilan en el lugar donde viven en la ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, dedicándose al  negocio de venta de achinería que es su negocio desde que comenzó a dedicarse al comercio.
Doña Fausta el préstamo lo necesita para  la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio como cosméticos, juguetes, adornos para navidad y  cosa de plásticos como bazos, platos y más.
Con el préstamo doña Fausta piensa mejorar su negocio.
El sueño de doña Fausta es tener un local propio donde vender sus productos y también desea construir su casa ya que donde vive es rentado.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012.
texts.en:
Fausta is 32 years old. She is the mother of three children and lives with her spouse, who is a merchant. They rent the house they live in in the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras where they work selling knickknacks, which is what they have done since they began their business. 

Fausta needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business. She needs cosmetics, toys, Christmas decorations and plastic items such as cups, plates and more. With the loan, Fausta is planning on improving her business. 

Fausta's dream is to own her own locale where she can sell her products and also build a house, since she rents now.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2012.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, toys, Christmas decorations and plastic items such as cups and plates and more for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beef, pork and chicken to increase her food sales

loans.name: Lissette Anayeli

texts.es: Lissette es  una persona muy  emprendedora  la cual  trabaja  en una fabrica  de la  localidad   pero  además  de  este  realiza   piñatas las   cuales  vende  con sus  conocidos, ella  esta  muy contenta de habernos  encontrado  ya que  nos  comenta  que  desea  hacer  crecer  su  negocio  por  lo  que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de  materia  prima  para la elaboración de  las   piñatas  ya  que  desea   seguir  brindado  a sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio que  la a caracterizado.
texts.en: Lissette is a very entrepreneurial person who works in a factory in her town.  She also makes piñatas which she sells to people she knows.  She is very happy to have found us because she tells us that she would like to grow her business.  She needs to buy raw materials for making piñatas because she would like to continue providing her customers with the same excellent service she is known for.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making piñatas.

loans.name: Gs Tablones I Group

texts.es:
La Señora Enma es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada a su negocio, Ella vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. En Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 3 años de tener el negocio de venta de leña.
Enma el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de leña y mano de obra y de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera mejorar sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes. Con estos fondos espera que su negocio sea más sólido y rentable.
Enma sus sueños es poder y darle a sus hijos una  mejor educación y ayudar a su familia.
Gerson se dedica a su negocio propio compra y venta de ganado  desde hace mas de 10 años en el mercado de esa zona.
Wilmer se dedica su negocio propio compra y venta de ganado. Desde hace mas de 6 años en varios caseríos de la zona.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Enma is a very enterprising person who is dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and her 3 children in Choluteca in southern  Honduras. She has had her business selling firewood for more than 3 years.

Enma will invest the loan in buying firewood and in paying for labor costs, thus increasing her sales. With the loan she hopes to improve her sales and thus serve her customers better. With these funds she hopes her business will more solid and profitable.

Enma dreams are to be able to give her children a better education and help her family.

Gerson has had his own business buying and selling cattle for more than 10 years in the area market.  
Wilmer has had his own business buying and selling cattle in various communities in the area.

Choluteca, Honduras - June, 2012

loans.use: to buy firewood and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Arenas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARENAS DEL MAR” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de helados, tejido de ropa de bebe, tienda de llantas, tienda de barrio, venta de refrescos y gelatinas, carnicería, trenzado de mantas, venta de comida, venta de mantas de alpaca.

La señora María Eugenia, indica que hace tres años y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora que fue a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por necesidad de trabajo y tener una entrada económica para ayudar a las necesidades del hogar.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el mejoramiento de su espacio de comercialización (compra de mostrador para poder exponer sus productos) este mueble lo comprará de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito; además de los cursillos abiertos pues las desestreza.
texts.en:
The “ARENAS DEL MAR” community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office.  The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors of which María Eugenia is the secretary.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in are varied and include: selling iced treats, knitting baby clothes, running a tire shop, running a neighborhood store, selling soft drinks and gelatin desserts, running a butcher's shop, braiding blankets, selling food and selling alpaca blankets.

María Eugenia says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, having been invited by a loan officer who visited her home.  She currently runs a neighborhood store.  She says that she started her business because she needed work and an income with which to help cover the needs of her household.

The loan that María Eugenia is currently taking out will be used to improve her sales location (she will buy a counter where she can display her products).  She will buy this piece of furniture in the street markets in the city of El Alto and then install it in her sales location.  Her work enables her to make income with which to support her family.  María Eugenia is married and has two children.

When asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, María Eugenia replied that she likes the health training and the loans.  She also likes the open courses where she can learn skills.

loans.use: to buy a counter

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Doña Maricela, ella es comerciante, con 7 años de experiencia, su negocio consiste en compra y venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de Masaya, diariamente ella viaja de su casa de habitación desde las cuatro de la madrugada para comprar las verduras y luego se ubica en su tramo a vender sus productos que ella ofrece, manifiesta que tiene su propia clientela fija y que gracias a Dios le va muy bien, ya que nunca deja de vender.
Se acerca nuevamente a nuestras oficinas Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo que le permita reabastecer su tramo, manifiesta que con los prestamos que ha adquirido con nosotros le han ayudado enormemente porque gracias a eso a mejorado su calidad de vida y le permitido cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maricela is a trader with 7 years experience.  Her business is buying and selling fruit and vegetables in Masaya town market.  She leaves her house at 4 o'clock every morning to buy her fruit and vegetables and then sets herself up in her sales spot to sell her products.  She says that she has her own regular customers and, thanks to God, her business is doing very well because she never stops selling.

Maricela has come to Ceprodel's offices once again to request a loan which will allow her to re-stock her business.  She says that the loans she has received in the past have helped her enormously because she has been able to improve her quality of life and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy bananas and avocados

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es: El banco comunal el Buen Pastor esta conformado por 8 integrantes, todos tiene diferentes actividades economicas los integrantes son:  Gloria del Socorro, Juan Carlos, Daneysis Yessenia, Ana Patricia, Martha, Maria Isabel, Catalina, Ana Patricia. Daneysis es la cordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad y union de los integrantes, tiene por actividad economica una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion del financiamiento comprar productos de consumo diario como: arroz, azucar, leche, pan frijoles aceite.
texts.en: The 'Buen Pastor' (Good Shepherd) community bank has eight members who all have different businesses.  They are: Gloria del Socorro, Juan Carlos, Daneysis Yessenia, Ana Patricia, Martha, Maria Isabel, Catalina and Ana Patricia. Daneysis is the group coordinator.  She is in charge of ensuring the responsibility and unity of the group's members.  Her business is a grocery store which is located in her home.  She will use this loan to buy household staples such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, beans and oil.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, bread, beans and oil

loans.name: 10 Estrellas Del Norte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “10 ESTRELLAS” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: hilado de vicuña, venta de chompas y suéteres, venta de chuño y papa, tienda surtida y varios, empanadas, queques y rollos, panadero, elaboración de embutidos.

La señora Lidia, indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora que fue a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de hilado y venta de lana de vicuña, ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por la recomendación de una de sus vecinas, pues ella ganaba mucho dinero y podía cuidad a sus hijos, es por eso que desde hace cuatro años atrás doña Lidia trabaja en este rubro.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) mismo que tendrá que desarrollar un proceso de hilado y posteriormente venderlo en las ferias tradicionales de la cuidad de El Alto los fines de semana. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito
texts.en:
The “10 ESTRELLAS” (Ten Stars) community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Limo regional office.  The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors which has Lidia as its president.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in are varied and include: spinning vicuña wool, selling sweaters, selling potato and freeze-dried potato, running a store, selling empanadas, cakes and rolls, and making sausages.

Lidia says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years.  She joined through an invitation from a loan officer who visited her home.  She currently has a business spinning and selling vicuña wool.  She says that she started this business on the recommendation of one of her neighbors who earned a lot of money and was able to take care of her children.  Lidia has been in this business for four years now.

Lidia will use the loan that she is currently taking out to increase her capital.  She will raw vicuña wool which she will then spin and sell in the traditional weekend street markets in the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lidia replied that she likes the health training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 47-year-old, married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the sari-sari store (corner store) and fishing business for 20 years now. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise such as canned goods, rice, sodas, etc. for her store and also to buy fishing nets for fishing.

Victoria spends her time supporting her husband in their business with the aim of meeting their financial needs, especially for the school expenses of their children. 

In the future, Victoria hopes to improve their livelihood to gain more income. This will give them the opportunity to continue sending their children to school. With the additional income, Victoria plans on reinvesting and saving for her family's future use.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise such as canned goods, rice, sodas, etc. for her store and also to buy fishing nets for fishing.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is engaged in a sari-sari store (convenience store) business in the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is 51 years old and has one adult son. While her husband is working as a driver, she is busy attending to her customers in her store. 

Elsa would like to expand her inventory by adding more merchandise to her store. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, corn, soft drinks and snack foods. Elsa's loan will make a big difference in her business and will make it more attractive to her customers. Her increased income will provide food for her family and also pay for her electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, soft drinks and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Zoila reside en el municipio de Catarina del departamento de Masaya, comerciante desde hace 15 años, el cual consiste en vender productos entre los que mencionamos plata, perezosa, hamacas, zapatos de varón y de vestir de mujer, entre otros. Ella viaja y sus punto de ventas son la Isla de Ometepe, Puerto Sandino, Malaca toya, sus viajes los realiza cada quince días, que es cuando su clientela le hace los pedidos.

Actualmente esta teniendo varios pedidos por lo que requiere invertir mas a su negocio se presenta a nuestras oficina para solicitar un financiamiento en el que pueda realizar las compras que ella necesita para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zoila lives in the city of Catarina in the department of Masaya. She has been a merchant for 15 years. She sells silver, hammocks, men’s shoes and women’s clothing and other items. She travels for work. Her sales stops are la Isla de Ometepe, Puerto Sandino and Malaca toya. She travels every five days when her customers make orders. 

Currently, she has various orders, so she needs to invest in her business more. She came to our office in order to request a loan so that she can make the needed purchases to fulfill her customer’s orders.

loans.use: purchase silver, hammocks, men’s shoes and women’s clothing and other items

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es: Juan es  una  persona muy  responsable  que se  preocupa  por el  bienestar de  su  familia y  por acondicionar  la  vivienda   que  con  esfuerzos  adquirió, en este   momento el  desea  construir  un  baño  en su  domicilio por  lo que se acerco a la institución  para  recibir  apoyo para la realización de su proyecto, ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad  de  proporcionar  a  su  familia un ambiente  cómodo  para  vivir por  lo que  agradece  el apoyo    incondicional  para  hacer  de su  sueño una realidad.
texts.en: Juan is a very responsible person who is concerned with providing for his family's well-being and re-modelling the house that he worked hard to acquire.  Right now he would like to build a bathroom in his home.  He approached the institution to receive support for his project.  He sees the loan as providing him with the possibility of ensuring his family has a comfortable environment in which to live.  He is grateful for the unconditional support he is receiving which will allow him to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Kombo

texts.en:
Kombo is a 42-year-old, hardworking man living in Tiribe, Kenya. He has a personal goal of expanding his business and educating his children to help them attain better academic qualifications. 

Kombo operates a retail shop business, which is very profitable despite the challenge of customers not paying on time. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and owning a grocery store. Kombo intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as shampoo, soaps, maize, wheat flour and sugar for sale. 

Kombo and his wife are blessed with five school-going children. They live happily in their own house although it has no electricity nor piped water. He hopes to proceed well with his business and repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as shampoo, soaps, maize, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married with two children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Alicia is a farmer who operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. Every month, she earns 3,000 PHP from this business. She has requested a loan of 4,300 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Alicia has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Alicia hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is from Maloro, Tangub City. She is 30 years old and single. 

To earn a living, Melba provides motor transport services in her local community. Melba has been engaged in this business for five years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

Melba joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of 10,600 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. 

Melba plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Gs Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
La señora Gladys de 58 años de edad, es viuda vive con sus nietos y dos hijos que están solteros, doña Gladis es una persona muy humilde y dedicada a su negocio, radica en el Tular de nacaome, al sur de Honduras, su casa es muy humilde y se dedica día a día a la venta  de ropa nueva y usada, y también vende cosméticos.
Ella es la líder del grupo solidario Gracias A Dios y esta muy contenta de apoyar a sus compañeros de grupo.
Doña Gladis esta solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para compra de Camisas, pantalones, ropa interior y faldas, con el préstamo ella desea salir adelante y seguir luchando con su negocio para sostener a su familia.
El sueño de doña Gladis es mejorar su vivienda y ampliar más su negocio.
Susana y Franklin se dedican a sus negocios a tiempo completo ya que son su fuente de ingresos.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Gladis is 58 years old.  She is a widow and lives with her grandchildren and two single children.  She is a very humble person who is committed to her business.  She comes from Tular, Nacaome, in the south of Honduras.  She lives in a very humble home and works every day selling new and used clothing.  She also sells cosmetics.

Gladis is the leader of the 'Gracias a Dios' (Thanks to God) solidarity group.  She is very happy to support her fellow group members.

Gladis is requesting 5,000 lempiras to buy shirts, trousers, underwear and skirts.  She hopes that the loan will enable her to make progress and continue working hard in her business in order to support her family.

Gladis' dream is to improve her home and further expand her business.

Susana and Franklin work full time in their businesses which are their source of income.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, underwear and skirts for her business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 38 years old and is married with four children. She works running a variety (sari-sari) store and her husband is a farmer. 

Fe is requesting a loan to buy additional merchandise such as toiletries, milk, coffee, seasoning, rice, canned goods, and noodles. She is hoping to improve her business so she can provide for her children's needs and pay their tuition fees. Fe is hoping that the profit generated from her loan will improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as toiletries, milk, coffee, seasoning, rice, canned goods, and noodles

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en: Pastora used her last loan to buy feed for her pigs. Her business is successful, so she is now taking on planting vegetables as an additional business. She is taking this new loan to buy fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Bendicion de Dios esta conformado por 10 integrantes los cuales son: Jeronima, Anita, Maura, Abrahan, Maria Mercedes, Cristina, Ana Francisca, Maria, Martha Maria Petrona, Anita es la cordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga del buen funcionamiento y coordinación entre los miembros, anita tiene por actividad economica la compra y venta de cerdo ya que es la actividad fuerte de la zona.
texts.en: The Bendicion de Dios communal bank has 10 members. They are Jeronima, Anita, Maura, Abrahan, Maria Mercedes, Cristina, Ana Francisca, Maria and Martha Maria Petrona. Anita is the coordinator of the communal bank. She looks after the good operation and coordination between the members. Anita buys and sells pigs since this is a strong business in the area.

loans.use: purchase and sell pigs.

loans.name: Oyunsuvdiin Buleg Group

texts.en:
Oyunsuvd is a-29-year-old lady who lives with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She started her felt manufacturing business in 2004. She makes felt sandals, felt souvenirs and other products which tourists traveling in Mongolia are interested in buying. In July, Mongolians have the great holiday Naadam, so during this holiday a lot of tourists come to Mongolia. Thus she needs to make more felt products.

Oyunsuvd is requesting a Kiva loan with Transcapital NBFI from Mongolia. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials in order to make more felt products and increase her income during the Naadam holiday.

loans.use: to purchase more felt to make more products.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is from Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old and is married with five children. To make a living, she buys and sells bananas. Josefa been in her business for 5 years and earns about 6,400 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Josefa joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 12,600 PHP, which will be used to buy more bananas to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is a 31-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 3 years to 13 years old. She describes herself to be a social and loyal woman. Nafisa operates a retail kiosk where she sells household items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents.

Nafisa describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy maize and wheat flour and other fast selling items to stock into her kiosk. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop in the future. Nafisa also hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flour and other fast selling items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising ducks and chickens in the Philippines. She has been raising ducks and chickens for 5 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

Josephine is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feeds for her ducks and chickens. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Faustine

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois sont encore à charge, Faustine vend des céréales et du bois de chauffage depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ses clients sont composés des béninois et des nigérians. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement. Ce financement lui permettra de participer à la formation professionnelle de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle souhaiterait élargir son activité afin d'avoir la grande part du marché.
texts.en: Married and the mother of five children, three of whom are still in her care, Faustine has been selling cereals and firewood for years. She stocks at one of the Benin markets. Her clients are from Benin and Nigeria. She has a credit history, so she requested and obtained a new loan. This loan will allow her to help pay for her children’s professional training as well as her own needs. She would like to expand her business and have a large part of the market.

loans.use: to buy one carload of firewood  and six bags of corn.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 31 years old and married with two children. She is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. For the past five years, Delma has been cooking and selling daily dishes to earn a living. She earns 5,000 PHP a month for her work. Delma joined GDMPC in 2010.

Delma is requesting a 8,700 PHP loan to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make food to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food to sell

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 53 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 15 and 25. Two of her children are in school and the others are working.  Alima lives in Coast Province, Kenya. For the past eight years, she has operated a kiosk and she is also a farmer. Despite her advanced age, Alima has shown a great deal of enterprise. Her children contribute to her income and she lives in a semi-permanent house without electricity or running water. 

Alima is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to stock her kiosk with maize flour, sugar, salt, and cooking oil. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to earn more income and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, salt, and cooking oil

loans.name: Enrique Alexander

texts.es: Enrique Alexander de 32 años de edad, casado, de la localidad de chinandega con tres hijos, tiene por actividad ecomonica la compra y venta de cerdos las cuales compro el la aldeas cercanas y distribuyo a clientes, a clientes fijos y eventuales, los cuales entrego a destazadores de cerdos, tiene 6 años de experiencia en el negocio, el fiananciamiento lo quiere para invertir en el mismo
texts.en: Enrique Alexander is 32 years old, married and from the town of Chinandega.  He has three children.  His business is buying and selling pigs.  He buys them in nearby villages and distributes them to customers, both regular and casual, who deliver them to pig slaughterers.  He has six years experience in his business.  He would like this loan to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 51 years old and married with six children. He lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Philippines. For the past 12 years, he has been a farmer, planting and harvesting rice to sell in his local community. Alex earns 10,000 PHP each month. He joined GDMPC in 2011.

Alex is requesting an 18,600 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for his next planting. In the future, he wants to save money as a reserve for emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for his next planting

loans.name: Lodgenia

texts.en: Lodgenia is 54 years old and widowed with four children. She is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Lodgenia used her previous loan to purchase the raw materials used in her business. Her business is successful, and she's requesting a new loan to obtain more food items to sell. In the future, Lodgenia hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to obtain more food items to sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a 56-year-old resident of Labo, Ozamis City. She provides her 2 children's needs from the little amount of 2,000 PHP she gains monthly from her banana production, which she has been doing for 6 years. 

In 2007 she became a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan at GDMPC micro-finance in the amount of 2,700 PHP to buy fertilizer. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, 40, resident of Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Danilo, a carpenter, and she is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business.

Gemma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Gemma earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gemma hopes her business will grow into a mini grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is from Labo, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old. Evangeline is married and has two children. To make a living, she owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. Evangeline been in her business for 14 years and earns about 14,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2006, Evangeline joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 24,600 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Togtokhsaikhan

texts.en:
Togtokhsaikhan is a 24-year-old young bachelor who lives with his mother, sister and brother-in-law in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Currently he works at a local company, but his current income isn’t enough for his living. So he decided to run a taxi business besides his daily work, in order to increase his family's income. He is requesting a 3,640,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to buy an old taxi from another. 

His goal is that he desires to buy a new apartment for his mother. “I really want to buy a new apartment and improve our living conditions in the future,” he said. He is a very hardworking and honest person who is willing to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to increase his family's income and improve his mother's living conditions.

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en:
Mueni is a 30-year-old woman who is married and a mother to three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a primary school teacher, but the income he earns isn't enough to cover the family's needs. For the past seven years, Mueni has been running a kiosk, and she needs more support to cover the costs. Mueni wants to add stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva through Yehu. She hopes to increase her income through this loan, and to provide better living conditions for the family. 
Thanks for her efforts together with her husband, all their children are in school.

loans.use: to add stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Narcisa Dalila

texts.es: Narcisa Dalila, de 57 años de edad, esta emprendedora tiene por actividad ecomomica mercaderia en general y pulperia tiene 15 años de tener el negocio y lo tiene ubicado de forma ambulante y en su casa, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar mercaderia como: ropa nueva pantalones, camisas, short, ropa interior y articulos personales la cual distribuye y recupero cada quince dias. Ya que la demanda me ha incrementado por lo consiguiente me beneficia y obtengo mayores utilidades,  gracias al apoyo que  leon 2000 me ha brinddo y el programa kiva con los financiamiento le logrado cumplir sueños y metas personales como terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Narcisa Dalila is 57 years old.  This entrepreneur's business is selling general merchandise and running a grocery store.  She has been in her business for 15 years and makes her sales both as an itinerant street vendor and from her home.  She would like this loan to buy merchandise such as new clothing, trousers, shirts, shorts, underwear and personal care products which she delivers and then collects payment on every two weeks.  "My demand has increased which has benefited me.  I now make more profits.  Thanks to the support that Leon 2000 and the Kiva program have given me through these loans, I have managed to fulfill my dreams and personal goals such as finishing building my house".

loans.use: to buy new clothing, trousers, shirts, shorts, underwear and personal care products

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment. In the future, Susana would like to save enough to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah used her last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Her business has grown and become successful. Sarah is requesting a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes to be able to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 52 years old and married with three children. Her eldest is 22 years old and her youngest is 18. For the past seven years, Florenda has been a rice farmer. Her husband works alongside her on their farm which is located in Talibon, Bohol, where she lives with her family. Farming is their sole source of income, so Florenda takes good care of her livelihood. 

Florenda is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide and to pay for labor. Once the needed inputs are available, she will work smoothly on her farm and expects a good harvest. Florenda will use the income generated with her loan for her family’s daily needs and to save and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide and to pay for labor

loans.name: 15 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “15 DE JUNIO” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en zapatos y sombreros, venta de material de construcción, costura de chamarras polar, elaboración de trajes, tejedora de mantas de lana, tienda de abarrotes, tejedora de polainas.

La señora Antonia, indica que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que fue a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de material de construcción, ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por el apoyo de su esposo, quien le comentó que la apertura de la tienda apoyaría a generar dinero y podía cuidad a sus hijos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de cemento) mismo que comprará de la fabrica y posteriormente venderlo en su espacio de comercialización todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el seguro de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank “15 DE JUNIO” [June 15th] will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Alto Lima. It has nine members and is directed by a board whose president is Antonia. The association members' businesses vary and among them are: making shoes and hats, selling construction materials, sewing fleece jackets, making suits, weaving wool blankets, running a grocery store, and weaving leggings. 

Antonia says that this is her first membership with a Pro Mujer communal bank; she joined at the invitation of a sponsor who came to her house. She now sells construction materials, a business she began with her husband's support. He said that opening the business would help them generate income and take care for the children.

This loan will be used to buy cement from the factory to resell in her shop. This work allows her to generate income to help her family as best she can as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the clinic and life insurance.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: Mech

texts.en:
Mech is 33 years old and married. She is blessed with three children who are attending school. Mech lives with her husband and children in a small village of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She earns a living by cultivating rice and vegetables to sell. She strives to work hard to provide basic needs and a good education for her children. Mech is currently busy with her rice farming business due to the coming rainfall. She has successfully borrowed and repaid two previous loans from HKL.

Mech is requesting her third loan which she will use to fix her house, parts of which are in ruin because it is so old. She will purchase wallboards and floorboards to replace broken ones. Her loan will be sufficient for Mech to fix her house on time and she hopes that her loan will provide a comfortable living situation for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new wallboards and floorboards to repair her house

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a married woman with three children, ages 15, 13, and 12. She is 42 years old and has operated a sari-sari store (a corner store) for more than a year now. Gregoria sells items like rice, canned goods, and cold drinks to the people in her community. This business provides her with income to cover their expenses. 

Gregoria is applying for a loan worth 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more items to sell, like rice, canned goods, and soda. In the future, Gregoria hopes to expand her retail business in order to cater to more customers in her locality. She believes that through loans she can augment her stocks and increase her income. Moreover, she wants to keep working in order to continue to send her children to school for a better education, which is really essential for their future.

loans.use: to buy addtional items to sell like rice, canned goods, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Gs Soni I Group

texts.es:
Doña Teresa es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada a su negocio, vive con sus 3 hijos en Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Ella tiene más de 4 años de tener el negocio de venta de comidas y golosinas.
Doña Teresa el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de refrescos, carnes, pollos y  condimentos, de esta manera incrementara mas sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes.
Con estos fondos espera que su negocio sea más sólido y rentable.
Doña Teresa sus sueños es poder  y darles a sus hijos una  mejor educación 
Manuela se dedica a su negocio venta de ropa nueva  desde hace mas de 3 años en el mercado de esa zona.
Saira se dedica a la venta de licuados y jugo de naranjas. Desde hace mas de 4 años.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Teresa, an enterprising woman dedicated to her work, lives with her 3 children in Choluteca in southern Honduras. She has been selling prepared foods and sweets for 4 years. Teresa will use the loan to buy soft drinks, meats, chicken, and condiments to increase sales and offer her customers better service. With the funds, she hopes her business will be stable and profitable.

Teresa dreams of a better education for her children.
Manuela has been selling new clothing in the area for more than 3 years.
Saira has been selling fruit shakes and orange juice for more than 4 years.
Choluteca, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meats, chicken, and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Chad

texts.en:
Chad's Pet Shop, LLC started as a home-based business in November 2011. Chad's bird breeding experience, love for animals, and dream of opening his own business prompted him to move into a commercial space and open Chad's Pet Shop. 

Chad is confident that his business will prosper as he fulfills a much needed service to the local community. "Thibodaux residents will no longer have to drive more than 30 miles to find a store that provides live pets and pet supplies because my store will offer quality and convenience to the public," explains Chad. Chad's future aspirations for his business is to open another store in the next two to four years, and eventually have three pet retail stores and two grooming/boarding facilities in Southeast Louisiana. Chad will use his Kiva loan for start-up costs and to purchase inventory and other supplies.

loans.use: to pay for start-up costs, inventory such as shelving, and live animals

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is 28 years old and married with two children who are two and seven years old. Both of her children are enrolled in school. For the past three years, Mwanamisi has been running a kiosk in her rural area, selling goods to her neighbors. She works hard to provide for her family and also earns an income selling farm produce. 

Mwanamisi is requesting a 30,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy additional items to sell. This is her first Kiva loan. In the future, Mwanamisi aspires to save money to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Mafanikio Group

texts.en:
Prisca, who is in her early 40s is single with one child who goes to school. She has been selling shirts, trousers and vegetables for three years now.  She works from 9 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzanian which she wants to use for buying more shirts, trousers and vegetables to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mafanikio" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
